<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Basic
	and diluted earnings per share for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, for which the basic average number of common
	shares are based on the 1,000,000,000&nbsp;common shares issued by our company upon the consummation of the reorganization on November&nbsp;18, 2015, as if those shares were issued as of the
	earliest date presented.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 Compared to Year Ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our revenues increased by 7.6% from RMB1,157.8&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB1,245.9&nbsp;million (US$192.3&nbsp;million) in 2015, primarily due to
	an increase in our net commissions and fees and other revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	76
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=80,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=911354,FOLIO='76',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DN48101A.;173',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DN48101_1_77">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Net Commissions and Fees
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our net commissions and fees increased by 15.1% from RMB860.8&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB990.7&nbsp;million (US$152.9&nbsp;million) in 2015,
	primarily due to the growth of our customer trading volume and increase in our average effective fee&nbsp;rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	customer trading volume increased by 5.8% from RMB623.4&nbsp;billion in 2014 to RMB659.7&nbsp;billion (US$101.8&nbsp;billion) in 2015, in line with our growing customer base and overall
	scale of&nbsp;operation. The relatively modest growth of our customer trading volume in 2015 was primarily due to challenging market conditions in the second half of 2015, including the sharp
	correction in A-share market from June to August 2015, which adversely affected investor's liquidity and confidence in trading.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	average effective fee rate increased from 0.138% in 2014 to 0.150% in 2015. This was mainly due to the increase in spread fee rate in the same period from our operation on the Tianjin Precious
	Metals Exchange. The spread fee rate is calculated as the spread fee, which is the difference between the bid and offer prices, divided by the trading price. The daily average closing price of silver,
	the main commodity traded on that exchange, decreased by 16.6% from RMB3,768&nbsp;per kilo in 2014 to RMB3,141&nbsp;per kilo in 2015, while the spread fee set by the exchange remained at
	RMB8&nbsp;per kilo, resulting in an increased spread fee rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Net Trading Gains/(Losses)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our net trading gains decreased by 38.1% from RMB268.9&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB166.4&nbsp;million (US$25.7&nbsp;million) in 2015. The net
	trading gains in 2014 included primarily the net realized gains from spot commodity contracts of RMB263.6&nbsp;million, which was the result of our customers' trading activities and our
	corresponding hedging activities. Our net trading gains from January&nbsp;1, 2015 to August&nbsp;22, 2015 were RMB156.7&nbsp;million from spot commodity contracts. Our net trading gains on spot
	commodity contracts from August&nbsp;23, 2015 to December&nbsp;31, 2015 were RMB9.3&nbsp;million and were transferred to a third party fund pursuant to our risk and return transfer arrangement
	that took effect on August&nbsp;23, 2015. As long as the risk and return transfer arrangement remains in force, we will not incur net gains or losses from spot commodity contracts, and we expect our
	net trading gains and losses in the future to be non-substantial.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Interest and Investment Income
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our interest and investment income increased from RMB0.4&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB4.4&nbsp;million (US$0.7&nbsp;million) in 2015, primarily
	due to an increase in our available-for-sale investments that we held during the relevant period.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Other Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our other revenues increased from RMB27.7&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB84.3&nbsp;million (US$13.0&nbsp;million) in 2015, primarily due to
	(i)&nbsp;awards of RMB38.0&nbsp;million (US$5.9&nbsp;million) from the Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange and the Guangdong Precious Metals Exchange for our contribution to the exchanges' overall
	trading volume in 2015, (ii)&nbsp;an increase in government grants of RMB35.7&nbsp;million (US$5.5&nbsp;million) due to increase in tax refund and government subsidies, and (iii)&nbsp;an
	increase in sales of silver products, which were partly offset by a decrease in sales of application services, due to a non-recurring sale transaction of our application services to a commodity
	trading service provider in&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our expenses increased by 19.1% from RMB638.5&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB760.7&nbsp;million (US$117.4&nbsp;million) in 2015, primarily due to
	growth of our&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Employee Compensation and Benefits
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our employee compensation and benefits increased from RMB214.4&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB388.2&nbsp;million (US$59.9&nbsp;million) in 2015, due
	to increase in both share-based compensation and other compensation and benefits. Our share-based compensation increased from RMB7.0&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB31.0&nbsp;million
	(US$4.8&nbsp;million) in 2015, due to costs associated with RSUs issued in January&nbsp;2015 and the increased recognized costs associated with options issued in December&nbsp;2014. Our other
	employee compensation and benefits increased from RMB207.4&nbsp;million in 2014&nbsp;to RMB357.2&nbsp;million (US$55.1&nbsp;million) in 2015,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	77
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=81,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=973489,FOLIO='77',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DN48101A.;173',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DN48101_1_78">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	largely
	resulting from the increase in our sales personnel when we hired approximately 800&nbsp;employees from third party sales agent companies in July&nbsp;2014, after we terminated customer
	development arrangements with such companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Advertising and Promotion
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our advertising and promotion expenses consist of advertising expenses and sales agent expenses. Our advertising expenses increased by 23.3% from
	RMB180.0&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB221.9&nbsp;million (US$34.2&nbsp;million) in 2015 due to the growth of our business. Our sales agent expenses decreased from RMB105.8&nbsp;million for 2014
	to nil for 2015, due to the termination of arrangements with sales agent companies on Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange in June&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Information Technology and Communications
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our information technology and communication expenses increased by 54.5% to RMB32.8&nbsp;million (US$5.1&nbsp;million) in 2015 compared to
	RMB21.2&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to the growth of our&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Occupancy and Equipment Rental
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our occupancy and equipment rental expenses increased slightly by 6.2% from RMB39.5&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB42.0&nbsp;million
	(US$6.5&nbsp;million) in 2015, primarily due to the increase of our office rental fees due to the growth in our operational scale.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Taxes and Surcharges
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our taxes and surcharges increased from RMB18.9&nbsp;million in 2014 to RMB21.7&nbsp;million (US$3.4&nbsp;million) in 2015, primarily due to
	increase in trading commissions in the Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange which are subject to business tax and surcharges on business tax, and an increase in trading commissions on Guangdong Precious
	Metals Exchange and an increase in revenue of Yin Tian Xia Technology from intra-group sale of application services, both of which are subject to VAT&nbsp;surcharges.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Other Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Other expenses decreased by 7.7% to RMB54.2&nbsp;million (US$8.4&nbsp;million) in 2015 from RMB58.7&nbsp;million in 2014, which is primarily due
	to the non-recurring miscellaneous expenses in&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Income Taxes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our income tax expenses significantly increased to RMB82.2&nbsp;million (US$12.7&nbsp;million) in 2015 from RMB37.4&nbsp;million in 2014,
	primarily due to the increase of our effective tax rate from 7% for 2014 to 17% for 2015. The increase in effective tax rate was mainly because the income tax rate of our subsidiary, Yin Tian Xia
	Technology, increased from 0% in 2014 to 12.5% in 2015 which will remain 12.5% through 2017. Except for Yin Tian Xia Technology, our other PRC subsidiaries are subject to an income tax rate
	of&nbsp;25%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Net Income
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As a result of the foregoing, our net income decreased to RMB403.0&nbsp;million (US$62.2&nbsp;million) in 2015 from RMB482.0&nbsp;million
	in&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 Compared to Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our revenues increased by 83.8% from RMB629.9&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB1,157.8&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to an increase in our net
	commissions and fees, as well as an increase in net trading gains and other&nbsp;revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Net Commissions and Fees
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our net commissions and fees increased by 108.3% from RMB413.3&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB860.8&nbsp;million in 2014. Excluding amounts shared
	with related parties of RMB116.2&nbsp;million in 2013, our net commissions and fees increased by 62.6% from RMB529.5&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB860.8&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to a
	66.8% increase in our customer trading volume from RMB373.8&nbsp;billion in 2013 to RMB623.4&nbsp;billion in 2014, which is slightly offset by the decrease of our average effective fee rate from
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	78
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=82,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=565859,FOLIO='78',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DN48101A.;173',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DN48101_1_79">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	0.142%
	in 2013 to 0.138% in 2014. The decrease in average effective fee rate is mainly due to our increased rebates on trading commissions as a result of increased competition. We shared
	RMB116.2&nbsp;million of spread fees with related parties in 2013 pursuant to our historical risk sharing agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Net Trading Gains/(Losses)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our net trading gains increased by 25.1% from RMB214.9&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB 268.9&nbsp;million in 2014. The net trading gains in 2013
	included primarily the net realized gains from spot commodity contracts of RMB 342.4&nbsp;million, which was the result of our customers' trading activities, offset by RMB128.1&nbsp;million shared
	with related parties pursuant to our historical risk sharing agreements. The net trading gains in 2014 included primarily the net realized gains from spot commodity contracts of RMB
	263.6&nbsp;million, which was a result of our customers' trading activities and our corresponding hedging activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Interest and Investment Income
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our interest income increased by 21.9% from RMB0.4&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB0.5&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to an increase in the
	available-for-sale investments we held, which usually bear higher interest rates than cash deposits with&nbsp;banks.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Other Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our other revenue significantly increased from RMB1.4&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB27.7&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to (i)&nbsp;an
	increase of sales of application services from RMB0.8&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB19.2&nbsp;million in 2014, resulting from the sales of our client software license and related services to a
	commodity trading service provider, (ii)&nbsp;an increase of sales of silver products, and (iii)&nbsp;local government grants of RMB4.6&nbsp;million we received in Shanghai in&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our expenses increased by 23.3% from RMB517.8&nbsp;million to RMB638.5&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to the growth of our&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Employee Compensation and Benefits
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our employee compensation and benefits increased by 158.7% from RMB82.9&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB214.4&nbsp;million in 2014. The number of our
	employees increased significantly from 1,002&nbsp;as of December&nbsp;31, 2013 to 1,970&nbsp;as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, primarily due to (i)&nbsp;our recruitment of certain sales and
	research staff who were employees of the sales agent companies and the research company after we terminated cooperation with them, and (ii)&nbsp;the increase in our employees in line with our
	business growth.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	incurred share-based compensation expenses of RMB7.0&nbsp;million in 2014 compared to RMB0.4&nbsp;million in 2013, mainly because our share-based compensation in 2014 reflected (i)&nbsp;the
	expenses associated with the share options granted in December&nbsp;2013 for which we incurred for the full year of 2014, and (ii)&nbsp;the expenses associated with the share options granted in
	December&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Advertising and Promotion
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our advertising and promotion expenses increased by 11.6% from RMB256.1&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB285.7&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to
	the increase in our advertising expenses, which was partly offset by a decrease in our sales agent&nbsp;expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	advertising expenses increased by 44.2% from RMB124.8&nbsp;million in&nbsp;2013 to RMB179.9&nbsp;million in 2014, which was in line with the growth of our customer base.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	From
	January&nbsp;2013 to June 2014, we hired sales agents to develop customers on the Tianjian Precious Metals Exchange, while we developed customers on our own on the Guangdong Precious Metals
	Exchange. We paid these sales agents fees as a percentage of the trading volume generated by the customers they developed. We terminated cooperation with all sales agent companies in June&nbsp;2014
	and moved the customer development
	function on the Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange in house. The sales agent expenses incurred was RMB131.3&nbsp;million in 2013 and RMB105.8&nbsp;million in&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	79
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=83,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=41007,FOLIO='79',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DN48101A.;173',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DN48101_1_80">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Research Services from a Related Party
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Research service represented the fees we paid to a related external research company for the research other services it provided to us. We had
	research service expenses of RMB106.1&nbsp;million in 2013. We did not incur research service expenses in 2014 because we terminated such arrangement in November&nbsp;2013 and moved research
	function in-house.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Information Technology and Communications
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our information technology and communication expenses increased significantly from RMB11.6&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB21.2&nbsp;million in 2014,
	primarily due to the growth of our&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Occupancy and Equipment Rental
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our occupancy and equipment rental expenses increased by 84.7% from RMB21.4&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB39.5&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to
	the increase of our office space, servers and other equipments in line with our business expansion.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Taxes and Surcharges
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our taxes and surcharges increased significantly from RMB5.2&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB18.9&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to increase in
	trading commissions on the Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange which are subject to business tax and surcharges on business tax, and an increase in trading commissions on Guangdong Precious Metals
	Exchange and an increase in revenue of Yin Tian Xia Technology from intra-group sale of application services, both of which are subject to VAT&nbsp;surcharges.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Other Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Other expenses increased from RMB34.6&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB58.7&nbsp;million in 2014, which is in line with our business growth.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Income Taxes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our income tax expenses significantly increased from RMB5.3&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB37.4&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily due to the increase in
	our profit before taxation from RMB112.2&nbsp;million to RMB519.3&nbsp;million, and the increase of our effective tax rate from 5.0% in 2013 to 7.0% in&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Net Income
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As a result of the foregoing, our net income increased from RMB106.8&nbsp;million in&nbsp;2013 to RMB482.0&nbsp;million in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	80
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Selected Quarterly Results of Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following table sets forth our historical unaudited selected quarterly results of operations for the eight quarters in the period from
	January&nbsp;1, 2014 to December&nbsp;31, 2015. You should read the following table in conjunction with our audited combined and consolidated financial statements and related notes thereto
	included elsewhere in this prospectus. The unaudited combined and consolidated quarterly results of operation include all adjustments that we consider necessary for a fair presentation of our
	operating results for the periods presented. Quarter-to-quarter comparison of operating results should not be relied upon as being indicative of future performance.
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<B>
	Revenues
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	quarterly total revenues have fluctuated during the eight-quarter period, largely due to the volatility of our trading gains and losses, which was primarily the result of our customers' trading
	activities. We present quarterly non-GAAP financial measures because they are used by our management to evaluate our core operating performance. We exclude from our adjusted revenues and adjusted net
	income (i)&nbsp;the net trading gains and losses resulting from our principal positions on the exchanges and (ii)&nbsp;the amounts we paid or received under the risk and return transfer
	arrangement, because we focus on our core business of generating trading commissions from our customers' trades and have been striving to reduce our exposure to market risks associated with principal
	positions. Our management believes the adjusted net income margin fairly presents useful information regarding the historical performance of our core business operation and is more comparable to our
	performance. However, due to the historical fluctuations of our quarterly financial
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	81
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	results,
	we believe that quarter-to-quarter comparisons of our financial results, on an adjusted or non-adjusted basis, should not be relied upon to predict our future performance.
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The
	amount of net trading gains from our principal positions as a result of serving as counterparty to our customers' trades on the Tianjin
	Precious Metals Exchange and the Guangdong Precious Metals Exchange.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The
	amounts we make or receive under the risk and return transfer arrangement with the third party fund. In 2015, we entered into a risk and
	return transfer arrangement with a third party fund, pursuant to which all our trading gains and losses resulting from our principal positions are transferred to such fund.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	(3)
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The
	amounts we pay or receive under the risk and return transfer arrangement with the third party fund. ln 2015, we entered into a risk and
	return transfer arrangement with a third party fund, pursuant to which all our trading gains and losses on these two exchanges are transferred to such fund. The arrangement took effect on
	August&nbsp;23, 2015 and as long as it remains in force, our net trading gains or losses on spot commodity contracts will be offset by the amount we pay or receive under the risk and return transfer
	arrangement.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	(4)
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Adjusted
	net income margin is adjusted net income divided by adjusted revenues.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

	The tables below set forth our major quarterly operating data on customer trading volume, tradable accounts and active accounts as of and for the periods
	indicated:

<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Tradable
	accounts refer to accounts that have been activated and have remained tradable as of the end of the period.

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">

	(1)

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Active
	accounts refer to tradable accounts that have executed at least one trade during the period.
</FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	82
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=86,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=814524,FOLIO='82',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DN48101A.;173',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DN48101_1_83">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our quarterly adjusted total revenues show a general trend of growth in the six-quarter period from January&nbsp;1, 2014 to June&nbsp;30, 2015, as a result
	of the growth of our quarterly total trading volume. Our quarterly total revenues slightly decreased in the third quarter of 2015, although it modestly increased in the fourth quarter of 2015, which
	was primarily due to the decreased trading activities of our customers resulting from the sharp correction of A-share market from June to August 2015 that adversely affected investor's liquidity and
	confidence in trading. Our quarterly total expenses generally grew in line with the growth of our business, except for periods where we made business arrangement adjustments. For example, in the third
	quarter of 2014, we incurred substantially higher advertising and promotion expenses because we terminated the contracts with our sales agent companies and paid a non-recurring termination fee. We
	recorded net income and adjusted net income in each of the eight quarters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	recorded a customer trading volume of RMB49.8&nbsp;billion, RMB68.8&nbsp;billion, RMB129.3&nbsp;billion and RMB125.8&nbsp;billion for the first, second, third and fourth quarter of 2013,
	respectively. Our average quarterly trading volume increased from RMB93.5&nbsp;billion in 2013 to RMB155.9&nbsp;billion in 2014 and further to RMB164.9&nbsp;billion (US$25.5&nbsp;billion) in
	2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	light of the foregoing limitations for these non-GAAP financial measures, when assessing our operating and financial performance, you should not consider adjusted revenues, adjusted net income or
	adjusted net income margin in isolation or as a substitute for our operating or financial performance measures that are calculated in
	accordance with U.S.&nbsp;GAAP. In addition, because these non-GAAP measures may not be calculated in the same manner by all companies, it may not be comparable to other similar titled measures used
	by other companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our principal sources of liquidity were cash generated from our operations and capital injections by our shareholders. We plan to finance our future
	operating liquidity primarily from cash generated from our operations and cash on hand. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, we had RMB83.5&nbsp;million and RMB362.5&nbsp;million
	(US$56.0&nbsp;million), respectively, in cash and cash equivalents which consisted of cash on hand and cash deposited with banks. We also held available-for-sale investments that can be redeemed on
	demand of RMB354.0&nbsp;million and RMB75.7&nbsp;million (US$11.7&nbsp;million) as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015. The available-for-sale investments we held are mainly wealth management
	products issued by banks and money market funds issued by fund management companies. We have been able to meet our working capital needs in the past, and we believe that we will be able to meet our
	working capital needs in the foreseeable future, with the estimated net proceeds from this offering, our internal financial resources and cash flow from our&nbsp;operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	following table sets forth a summary of our cash flows for the periods indicated:
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->

<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=87,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=922532,FOLIO='83',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DN48101A.;173',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DN48101_1_84">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Operating Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We had net cash generated from operating activities of RMB430.8&nbsp;million (US$66.5&nbsp;million) in 2015, primarily attributable to our net
	income of RMB403.0&nbsp;million (US$62.2&nbsp;million), as adjusted for non-cash items and the effect of changes in working capital including: (i)&nbsp;a decrease in deposits with exchanges,
	which serve as clearing organizations, in the amount of RMB17.3&nbsp;million (US$2.7&nbsp;million) as a result of fluctuation in trading activities by our customers and our risk management
	decision on deposit level on the last day of the relevant periods (ii) non-cash share-based compensation expenses of RMB31.0&nbsp;million (US$4.8&nbsp;million), (iii)&nbsp;unrealized gain from
	derivatives in the amount of RMB13.9&nbsp;million (US$2.1&nbsp;million), (iv)&nbsp;an increase in accrued employee benefits of RMB28.0&nbsp;million (US$4.3&nbsp;million) due to our increased
	payroll size and (v)&nbsp;depreciation of RMB11.9&nbsp;million (US$1.8&nbsp;million). These were partially offset by (i)&nbsp;a decrease in other liabilities arising from operating activities
	of RMB21.7&nbsp;million (US$3.4&nbsp;million), (ii)&nbsp;an increase in other assets of RMB21.2&nbsp;million (US$3.3&nbsp;million) and (iii)&nbsp;a decrease in accounts payable of
	RMB19.5&nbsp;million (US$3.0&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	had net cash generated from operating activities of RMB431.5&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily attributable to our net income of RMB482.0&nbsp;million, as adjusted for non-cash items and the
	effect of changes in working capital including: (i)&nbsp;an increase in accrued employee benefits of RMB28.5&nbsp;million due to our increased payroll size, (ii)&nbsp;an increase in other
	liabilities arising from operating activities of RMB33.9&nbsp;million due to our business growth, and (iii)&nbsp;an increase in income tax payable of RMB20.8&nbsp;million due to our increase in
	profit before taxes and income taxes. These were partially offset by (i)&nbsp;an increase in deposits with exchanges, which serve as clearing organizations, in the amount of RMB109.7&nbsp;million
	as a result of fluctuation in trading activities by our customers and our risk management decision on deposit level on the last day of the relevant periods, (ii)&nbsp;a decrease in other assets of
	RMB24.8&nbsp;million due to our business growth, (iii)&nbsp;a decrease in amounts due to related parties of RMB7.7&nbsp;million, and (iv)&nbsp;a decrease in accounts payable in the amount of
	RMB7.4&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	had net cash used in operating activities of RMB22.0&nbsp;million in 2013, attributable to our net income of RMB 106.8&nbsp;million, as adjusted for non-cash items and effect of changes in
	working capital including (i)&nbsp;an increase in accrued employee benefits of RMB13.3&nbsp;million due to our increased payroll size, and (ii)&nbsp;an increase in other liabilities arising from
	operating activities of RMB14.8&nbsp;million due to our business growth. These were offset by (i)&nbsp;an increase in deposits with exchanges, which serve as clearing organizations, in the amount
	of RMB50.0&nbsp;million due to increase in our customers' trading activities and our risk management decision on deposit level on the last day of the relevant periods, (ii)&nbsp;a decrease of
	RMB59.1&nbsp;million in amount due to related parties, (iii)&nbsp;a decrease in accounts payables of RMB33.1&nbsp;million, and (iv)&nbsp;an increase in other assets of RMB23.6&nbsp;million
	due to our business growth.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Investing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We had net cash generated by investing activities of RMB179.9&nbsp;million (US$27.8&nbsp;million) in 2015, primarily attributable to cash received
	from (i)&nbsp;sale of available-for-sale investments in the amount of RMB5,148.7&nbsp;million (US$794.8&nbsp;million) and (ii)&nbsp;repayment of loans from related parties in the amount of
	RMB47.0&nbsp;million (US$7.3&nbsp;million), which was offset by cash paid for (i)&nbsp;purchase of available-for-sale investments of RMB4,862.2&nbsp;million (US$750.6&nbsp;million),
	(ii)&nbsp;payment for the acquisition of our subsidiaries pursuant to the reorganization in the amount of RMB107.3&nbsp;million (US$16.6&nbsp;million), (iii)&nbsp;issuance of loans to related
	parties of RMB40.0&nbsp;million (US$6.2&nbsp;million), and (iv)&nbsp;purchases of equipment and leasehold improvements of RMB8.6&nbsp;million (US$1.3&nbsp;million) primarily associated with
	the addition of office space and equipment to support our business growth.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	had net cash used in investing activities of RMB327.7&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily attributable to cash used in (i)&nbsp;purchase of available-for-sale investments of
	RMB2,218.0&nbsp;million, (ii)&nbsp;purchase of equipment and leasehold improvements of RMB13.3&nbsp;million, and (iii)&nbsp;issuance of loans to related parties in the amount of
	RMB28.0&nbsp;million, which was partly offset by (i)&nbsp;cash received from sale of available-for-sale investments in the amount of RMB1,896.9&nbsp;million, (ii)&nbsp;cash received from loan
	repayments from related
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	84
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</A>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	parties
	of RMB21.5&nbsp;million and (iii)&nbsp;cash received from loan repayments from third parties of RMB13.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	had net cash provided by investing activities of RMB31.6&nbsp;million in 2013, primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;cash received from sale of available-for-sale investments of
	RMB428.4&nbsp;million, and (ii)&nbsp;cash received from repayment of loans from related parties in the amount of RMB189.4&nbsp;million, which was offset by (i)&nbsp;cash paid for purchase of
	equipment and leasehold improvements in the amount of RMB20.6&nbsp;million, (ii)&nbsp;cash paid for purchase of available-for-sale investments of RMB458.0&nbsp;million, (iii)&nbsp;issuance of
	loans of RMB99.8&nbsp;million to related parties, and (iv)&nbsp;issuance of loans of RMB13.0&nbsp;million to third&nbsp;parties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Financing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We had net cash used in financing activities of RMB331.8&nbsp;million (US$51.2&nbsp;million) in 2015, primarily attributable to dividends of
	RMB705.0&nbsp;million (US$108.8&nbsp;million) paid by our PRC subsidiaries to a holding company wholly owned by our shareholders prior to our reorganization, which was partially offset by
	(i)&nbsp;proceeds from capital contribution by our shareholders in the amount of RMB254.3&nbsp;million (US$39.3&nbsp;million) and (ii)&nbsp;proceeds from borrowings from related parties in the
	amount of RMB118.9&nbsp;million (US$18.4&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	had net cash used in financing activities of RMB129.5&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;dividends of RMB100.0&nbsp;million to a holding company wholly owned by our
	shareholders and (ii)&nbsp;repayments of borrowings from related and third parties, which was slightly offset by proceeds from capital contribution by our shareholders in the amount of
	RMB16.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	had net cash generated from financing activities of RMB33.2&nbsp;million in 2013, primarily attributable to proceeds from borrowings from related parties in the amount of RMB50.7&nbsp;million
	and from third parties in the amount of RMB13.0&nbsp;million, which was partly offset by repayment of borrowings of RMB20.5&nbsp;million from related parties and repayment of borrowings from
	third&nbsp;parties of RMB10.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Capital Expenditures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our capital expenditures consist primarily of expenditures for the purchase of fixed assets and intangible assets. Our capital expenditures amounted
	to RMB21.5&nbsp;million, RMB15.1&nbsp;million and RMB11.9&nbsp;million (US$1.8&nbsp;million) in 2013, 2014 and&nbsp;2015, respectively, primarily due to purchases of electronic and office
	equipment and leasehold improvements for our office space as a result of our business growth.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Total
	rental expenses for all operating leases were RMB11.2&nbsp;million, RMB20.5&nbsp;million and RMB24.4&nbsp;million (US$3.8&nbsp;million) for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014
	and 2015, respectively. We did not have any significant capital and other commitments, long-term obligations or guarantees as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Off-Balance Sheet Commitments and Obligations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We have not entered into any financial guarantees or other commitments to guarantee the payment obligations of any third parties. In addition, we have
	not entered into any derivative contracts that are indexed to our shares and classified as shareholders' equity or that are not reflected in our combined and
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	85
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=89,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=620938,FOLIO='85',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DN48101A.;173',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DN48101_1_86">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	consolidated
	financial statements. Furthermore, we do not have any retained or contingent interest in assets transferred to an unconsolidated entity that serves as credit, liquidity or market risk
	support to such entity. Moreover, we do not have any variable interest in any unconsolidated entity that provides financing, liquidity, market risk or credit support to us or engages in leasing,
	hedging or research and development services with&nbsp;us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Inflation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Since our inception, inflation in China has not materially impacted our results of operations. According to the National Bureau of Statistics of
	China, the year-over-year percent changes in the consumer price index for December&nbsp;2013 and December&nbsp;2014 were increases of 2.6% and 2.0%. Although we have not in the past been
	materially affected by inflation since our inception, we can provide no assurance that we will not be affected in the future by higher rates of inflation in&nbsp;China.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Holding Company Structure
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are a holding company with no material operations of our own. We conduct our operations through our subsidiaries in China. As a result, our ability
	to pay dividends and to finance any debt we may incur depends upon dividends paid by our subsidiaries. Our PRC subsidiaries may purchase foreign exchange from relevant banks and make distributions to
	offshore companies after completing relevant foreign exchange registration with the SAFE. Our offshore companies may inject capital into or provide loans to our PRC subsidiaries through capital
	contributions or foreign debts, subject to applicable PRC regulations. If our subsidiaries or any newly formed subsidiaries incur debt on their own behalf in the future, the instruments governing
	their debt may restrict their ability to pay dividends to us. In addition, our subsidiaries are permitted to pay dividends to us only out of its retained earnings, if any, as determined in accordance
	with PRC accounting standards and regulations. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our PRC subsidiaries had an aggregate retained earnings of RMB71.3&nbsp;million (US$11.0&nbsp;million) under PRC
	GAAP. Under PRC law, each of our affiliates in China is required to set aside at least 10% of its after-tax profits each year, if any, to fund a statutory reserve until such reserve reached 50% of its
	registered capital, after which any mandatory appropriation stops. Our PRC subsidiaries had an aggregate statutory reserves in the amount of RMB35.4&nbsp;million (US$5.5&nbsp;million) as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015. Yin Tian Xia Technology has reached its maximum reserve amount and it has stopped appropriation, while other PRC entities have not yet reached their respective maximum
	reserve amounts. Although the statutory reserves can be used, among other ways, to increase the registered capital and eliminate future losses in excess of retained earnings of the respective
	companies, the reserve funds are not distributable as cash dividends except in the event of liquidation of the companies. At the discretion of our PRC subsidiaries, they may allocate a portion of
	their after-tax profits to discretionary funds for staff welfare and bonus. Such discretionary funds, similar to statutory reserves, are not distributable as cash dividends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosure about Market Risks
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Foreign Exchange Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	All of our revenues and substantially all of our expenses are denominated in RMB. In our combined and consolidated financial statements, our financial
	information that uses RMB as the functional currency has been translated into U.S.&nbsp;dollars. Currently our exposure to foreign exchange risk primarily relates to our cash and cash equivalents
	denominated in U.S.&nbsp;dollars as a result of the proceeds from this offering. We do not believe that we currently have any significant direct foreign exchange risk and have not used any
	derivative financial instruments to hedge exposure to such risk. Although in general our exposure to foreign exchange risks should be limited, the value of your investment in our ADSs will be affected
	by the exchange rate between U.S.&nbsp;dollar and RMB because the value of our business is effectively denominated in RMB, while our ADSs will be traded in U.S.&nbsp;dollars.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	86
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=11,SEQ=90,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=178569,FOLIO='86',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DN48101A.;173',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DN48101_1_87">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	conversion of RMB into foreign currencies, including U.S.&nbsp;dollars, is based on rates set by the PBOC. The PRC government allowed the RMB to appreciate by more than 20% against the
	U.S.&nbsp;dollar between July&nbsp;2005 and July&nbsp;2008. Between July&nbsp;2008 and June&nbsp;2010, the exchange rate between the RMB and the U.S.&nbsp;dollar had been stable and traded
	within a narrow band. Since June&nbsp;2010, the PRC government has allowed the RMB to appreciate slowly against the U.S.&nbsp;dollar, though there have been periods when the RMB has depreciated
	against the U.S.&nbsp;dollar. In particular, on August&nbsp;11, 2015, the PBOC allowed the RMB to depreciate by approximately 2% against the U.S.&nbsp;dollar. It is difficult to predict how long
	the current situation may last and when and how the relationship between the RMB and the U.S.&nbsp;dollar may change&nbsp;again.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	To
	the extent that we need to convert U.S.&nbsp;dollars into RMB for our operations, appreciation of the RMB against the U.S.&nbsp;dollar would have an adverse effect on the RMB amount we receive
	from the conversion. Conversely, if we decide to convert RMB into U.S.&nbsp;dollars for the purpose of making payments for dividends on our ordinary shares or ADSs or for other business purposes,
	appreciation of the U.S.&nbsp;dollar against the RMB would have a negative effect on the U.S.&nbsp;dollar amounts available to&nbsp;us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	estimate that we will receive net proceeds of approximately US$90.2&nbsp;million from this offering if the underwriters do not exercise their option to purchase additional ADSs, after deducting
	underwriting discounts and commissions and the estimated offering expenses payable by us, based on the initial offering price of US$13.50 per ADS, the midpoint of the estimated initial public offering
	price range shown on the cover page of this prospectus. Assuming that we convert the full amount of the net proceeds from this offering into RMB, a 10% appreciation of the U.S.&nbsp;dollar against
	the RMB, from the exchange rate of RMB6.4778 for US$1.00 as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 to a rate of RMB7.1256 to US$1.00, will result in an increase of RMB58.4&nbsp;million in our net proceeds from
	this offering. Conversely, a 10% depreciation of the U.S.&nbsp;dollar against the RMB, from the exchange rate of RMB6.4778 for US$1.00 as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 to a rate of RMB5.8300 to
	US$1.00, will result in a decrease of RMB58.4&nbsp;million in our net proceeds from this&nbsp;offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Interest Rate Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our exposure to interest rate risk primarily relates to the floating interest rates for our own cash deposited with&nbsp;banks.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	have not been exposed to material risks due to changes in market interest rates, and we have not used any derivative financial instruments to manage our interest risk exposure. However, we cannot
	provide assurance that we will not be exposed to material risks due to changes in market interest rate in the future. To the extent we decide to do so in the future, we cannot be assured that any
	future hedging activities will protect us from fluctuations in interest&nbsp;rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Price Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Price risk is the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market prices (other
	than those arising from interest rate risk or currency risk), whether those changes are caused by factors specific to the individual financial instrument or factors affecting all similar financial
	instruments traded in the&nbsp;market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	price risk exposure mainly comes from (i)&nbsp;spot commodity contracts we enter into when we serve as counterparty to our customers' trades, (ii)&nbsp;spot commodity contracts with special
	members for hedging the price risks identified in (i), (iii)&nbsp;trading of physical commodities (mostly silver) and commodity futures contracts we enter into for hedging the risks related to
	physical commodity trading. The values of these contracts will fluctuate as a result of changes in market price of commodities, exposing us to price risks. In 2015, we entered into a risk and
	return transfer arrangement with a third party fund, pursuant to which, although we still act as counterparty to our customers' trades, our gains and losses from our principal trading positions on the
	Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange and the Guangdong Precious Metals Exchange will be transferred to the fund. As long as such arrangement remains in force, we will no longer be exposed
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	87
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to
	price risks in relation to spot commodity contracts on these two exchanges. We do not hold principal positions and therefore, are not exposed to price risks from our operation on the Shanghai
	Gold&nbsp;Exchange.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	following table indicates the effect on our profit after tax and retained profits that would happen if at the period end as indicated, it is estimated that an increase or decrease in the relevant
	commodity prices, as applicable, with all other variables held constant. However, there are inherent limitations of sensitivity analysis and you should review the following information together with
	other sections under "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of&nbsp;Operations."
</FONT>
</P>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-LEFT:8PT;TEXT-INDENT:-8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&#151;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-LEFT:8PT;TEXT-INDENT:-8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Increase&nbsp;/&nbsp;Decrease of 10% in the relevant commodity&nbsp;prices
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(26,341)&nbsp;/&nbsp;26,341
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(65,924)&nbsp;/&nbsp;65,924
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&#151;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, a decrease (increase) of 5% and 10% in the relevant commodity prices would increase (decrease) our trading
	gains/losses from spot commodity contracts and increase (decrease) on our profit after tax and retained profits of approximately RMB70.9&nbsp;million and RMB141.8&nbsp;million
	(US$21.9&nbsp;million), which would be offset by the risk and return transfer arrangement with the fund. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the net asset value of the fund was RMB245.5&nbsp;million
	(US$37.9&nbsp;million) and the risk and return transfer arrangement was in full force. Therefore, the effect of relevant commodity price movement on our profit after tax and retained profits was nil
	as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Credit Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Credit risk is the risk that counterparties may fail to honor their obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	are exposed to credit risks of the third party fund that has entered into a risk and return transfer arrangement with us. Pursuant to the arrangements which took effect on August&nbsp;23, 2015
	with an initial term of five years, the fund will assume all the gains and losses resulting from our principal positions on the Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange and the Guangdong Precious Metals
	Exchange. To manage the credit risks of the fund, we require the fund to maintain a net asset value of not less than 100% of the aggregate minimum deposits we need to place
	with the two exchanges. The fund has placed capital in a bank account under its name and under joint administration of the fund and us, and the fund cannot withdraw or make transfer from the bank
	account without our approval. For more details of the risk and return transfer arrangement, please see "Business&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Risk
	Management&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Trading Reloaded Risks." As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the net asset of value of such fund was RMB245.5&nbsp;million (US$37.9&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	are also exposed to the credit risks of banks with respect to our cash deposit, wealth management products and deposits with the exchanges. Substantially all of our cash at banks and wealth
	management products are deposited in state-owned or state-controlled PRC banks. Our deposits with the exchanges are deposited in depositary banks which are generally national commercial banks
	designated by commodity exchanges.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In May&nbsp;2014, the Financial Accounting Standards Board, or FASB, issued ASU No.&nbsp;2014-09, Revenue from Contracts with Customers, which
	outlines a comprehensive new revenue recognition model designed to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity
	expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. The accounting standard is effective for annual reporting periods (including interim reporting periods within those periods) beginning
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	88
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=13,SEQ=92,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=992785,FOLIO='88',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DN48101A.;173',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DN48101_1_89">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	after
	December&nbsp;15, 2016. Early adoption is not permitted. We are in the process of evaluating the impact of adoption of this guidance on our combined and consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	January&nbsp;2016, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2016-01, Financial Instruments. Overall, the amendments in ASU 2016-01&nbsp;include, but are not limited to, the following:
	(i)&nbsp;requiring equity investments (except those accounted for under the equity method of accounting or those that result in consolidation of the investee) to be measured at fair value with
	changes in fair value recognized in net income; however, an entity may choose to measure equity investments that do not have readily determinable fair values at cost minus impairment, if any, plus or
	minus changes resulting from observable price changes in orderly transactions for the identical or a similar investment of the same issuer; (ii)&nbsp;simplifying the impairment assessment of equity
	investments without readily determinable fair values by requiring a qualitative assessment to identify impairment, which means that when a qualitative assessment indicates that impairment exists, an
	entity is required to measure the investment at fair value; (iii)&nbsp;eliminating the requirement to disclose the fair value of financial instruments measured at amortized cost for entities that
	are not public business entities; (iv)&nbsp;eliminating the requirement for public business entities to disclose the method(s) and significant assumptions used to estimate the fair value that is
	required to be disclosed
	for financial instruments measured at amortized cost on the balance sheet; (v)&nbsp;requiring public business entities to use the exit price notion when measuring the fair value of financial
	instruments for disclosure purposes; (vi)&nbsp;requiring an entity to present separately in other comprehensive income the portion of the total change in the fair value of a liability resulting from
	a change in the instrument-specific credit risk when the entity has elected to measure the liability at fair value in accordance with the fair value option for financial instruments;
	(vii)&nbsp;requiring separate presentation of financial assets and financial liabilities by measurement category and form of financial asset (i.e.,&nbsp;securities or loans and receivables) on the
	balance sheet or the accompanying notes to the financial statements; (viii)&nbsp;clarifying that an entity should evaluate the need for a valuation allowance on a deferred tax asset related to
	available-for-sale securities in combination with the entity's other deferred tax assets. The new standard is effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017. We are in
	the process of evaluating the impact of adoption of this guidance on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	89
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_DW48101_INDUSTRY">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_DW48101_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	INDUSTRY
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Background
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	China is the world's second largest economy and its GDP has grown steadily over the last three decades since it opened up in the 1980s. China's real
	GDP grew at an average rate of 7.8% from 2011 to 2015. Although China's real GDP growth slowed down to 6.9% in 2015, the International Monetary Fund forecasts China's real GDP growth to be 6.3% and
	6.0% in 2016 and 2017, while the forecast for global economic growth is 3.4% and 3.6% for the same&nbsp;period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	According
	to a report published by China Merchants Bank and Bain&nbsp;&amp; Company, total investable assets held by Chinese residents grew at a CAGR of 19.2% from RMB39.0&nbsp;trillion in 2008 to
	RMB112.0&nbsp;trillion in 2014. It is estimated to grow to RMB129.0&nbsp;trillion in 2015, and is expected to grow at a CAGR of 12.7% from 2016 to 2021. In addition, the population of
	high-net-worth individuals (with at least RMB10&nbsp;million of investable assets) increased from 0.3&nbsp;million in 2008 to approximately 1.0&nbsp;million in 2014. The aggregate wealth owned
	by such individuals reached RMB32.0&nbsp;trillion in 2014. The rapid accumulation of personal wealth and increased population of affluent individuals in China have stimulated the market demand for
	investment products and related services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Introduction of Commodity Trading
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Commodities in the financial market generally refer to the primary products that are widely used as raw materials, such as agricultural products,
	non-ferrous metals, precious metals, chemical products and energy products. The commodity trading market can, based on the time of settlement, be divided into the spot market, in which the purchase
	and sale of goods are for immediate delivery or permanently extended, and the futures market, in which the purchase and sale of goods will take place on a contracted future date. It can also, based on
	the trading platform, be divided into the online market and offline market, depending on whether a trade is executed online or offline. The rapid development of information technology has made online
	trading more efficient and convenient and gradually gain popularity among traders and investors who trade commodities as an investment&nbsp;tool.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	History of Online Spot Commodity Trading Market in China
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Electronic trading of commodities was first developed in China through futures markets in the 1990s. In 2002, the Shanghai Gold Exchange was
	established by the PBOC with approval of the State Council for spot trading of gold and other precious metals, marking it a key milestone in the development of
	online spot commodity trading market in China. Initially, trading on the exchange was open to institutional investors only. Since 2006, individual investors were also permitted to open trading
	accounts. The Shanghai Gold Exchange remains the only national exchange for spot commodity trading and the only exchange permited to conduct spot trading of gold. In 2008, pursuant to the "early pilot
	and experimentation" policies, the Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange was established with approval from Tianjin Municipality People's Government as one of the first major provincial exchanges for
	online spot commodity trading. Since then, provincial and other local governments have approved the establishment of hundreds of spot commodity exchanges, in an effort to formalize the previous
	underground trading of commodities and enhance China's pricing capability in global commodities markets. As new commodity exchanges emerge, new types of commodities are introduced to the market,
	providing investors with more trading products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Driven
	by supportive government measures and the increasing demand for new investment products by Chinese investors, online spot commodity trading has recently emerged as an alternative investment
	product in China. The trading volume of online spot commodity trading grew at a CAGR of 35.4% from 2011 to 2015, reaching RMB29.0&nbsp;trillion (US$4.5 trillion) in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	90
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=94,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=170696,FOLIO='90',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]DW48101A.;170',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;12:49' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_DW48101_1_91">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	table below illustrates the trading volume and growth trend of the online spot commodity trading market in China. Precious metals, primarily gold and silver, have been the main trading products,
	with a combined trading volume increasing from RMB6.6&nbsp;trillion in 2011 to RMB19.3&nbsp;trillion in 2015, representing a CAGR of 30.7%, and their trading volume is expected to further increase
	with a CAGR of 24.6% from 2015 to&nbsp;2020.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->

</DIV>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Source:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Shanghai Gold Exchange Monthly Report, People's Bank of China Yearly Report, the MOFCOM, and the Euromonitor Industry Report.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Precious
	metals include gold, silver, platinum and palladium.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Others
	include, but are not limited to, nickel, copper, aluminum, oil, agricultural products and petro-chemical products.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Features of Online Spot Commodity Trading
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The rapid growth of online spot commodity trading in recent years is largely attributable to its distinct features that appeal to individual investors
	in China. In general, Chinese individual investors have demonstrated strong appetite for volatility. Among major investment products including wealth management products, money market funds, stocks,
	real estates and bank deposits, stock trading generally
	involves higher volatility and stocks are heavily traded by individual investors. According to the Shanghai Stock Exchange Statistics Annual 2015, the turnover rate on the Shanghai Stock Exchange or
	SHSE, which is annual trading volume divided by total public float, was 4.4&nbsp;times in 2014, significantly higher than the 0.8&nbsp;times on the New York Stock Exchange in the same year.
	Moreover, according to SHSE Annual Statistics 2015, 85.2% of the trading volume on SHSE in 2014 was generated by individual investors who held 23.5% of the total market capitalization of SHSE, which
	is in sharp contrast to institutional investors who generated only 11.6% of the trading volume out of a 14.7% holding of the total market capitalization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Online
	spot commodity trading is often conducted based on deposits and with a leverage ratio of 5 to 20&nbsp;times, and allows for long and short trading directions. This offers relatively high
	volatility trading opportunities which appeal to certain Chinese individual investors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	91
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	table below compares the trading features of spot commodity trading with stocks and commodity futures in China. These trading features apply to precious metals and some other spot commodities, but
	not to all spot commodities or to all exchanges.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	Mainly precious metals including gold and silver, as well as other commodities
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</FONT>

</FONT>
</TD>

</FONT>

</FONT>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
