<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	*
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Each
	of the Independent Director Appointees has accepted the appointment to serve as our Independent Director immediately effective upon the listing of our
	ADSs on NASDAQ.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Wenbin Chen
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is our Founder, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. Mr.&nbsp;Chen has 16&nbsp;years of
	experience in the finance industry. He worked at Fuzhou Tianli Investment Consulting&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. from July&nbsp;1998 to July&nbsp;2005, with his last position being deputy general
	manager. Mr.&nbsp;Chen founded Fujian Rulin Information Technology Development&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. in July&nbsp;2005 and served as its general manager until June&nbsp;2007. Between
	August&nbsp;2007 and June&nbsp;2010, Mr.&nbsp;Chen was Assistant to the Chief Executive Officer of Caifu Software (Beijing)&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. Mr.&nbsp;Chen graduated from Dalian
	University of Technology with a double bachelor's degree in chemical engineering and international enterprise management in July&nbsp;1998. He graduated in October&nbsp;2009 from Cheung Kong
	Graduate School of Business with an EMBA degree.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Ming Yan
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is our Founder and Director. Mr.&nbsp;Yan has founded a number of entertainment, culture and catering businesses in Beijing,
	Shanghai and Hong Kong. Mr.&nbsp;Yan graduated from Shanxi University of Finance with a bachelor degree in Finance in December&nbsp;2011. He graduated in September&nbsp;2014 from the Cheung Kong
	Graduate School of Business with an EMBA degree. Mr.&nbsp;Yan has been enrolled in the Doctor of Business Administration program at Shanghai Jiao Tong University since September&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ms.&nbsp;Ningfeng Chen
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is our Founder and Director. From September&nbsp;1990 to September&nbsp;2001, Ms.&nbsp;Chen worked as an engineer at Fuzhou
	Office of Earthquake Resistance and Fuzhou Urban and Rural Construction Committee. Between September&nbsp;2001 and September&nbsp;2003, Ms.&nbsp;Chen served as the chief engineer at Fuzhou
	Anxinda Engineering Consulting&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. She was a North American market research consultant at Shanghai Naide Enterprise Management Consulting between September&nbsp;2005 and
	February&nbsp;2011. Ms.&nbsp;Chen graduated from Anhui Institute of Architecture&nbsp;&amp; Industry with a bachelor degree in industrial and civil construction in July&nbsp;1990. In
	June&nbsp;2003, Ms.&nbsp;Chen graduated from the University of International Business and Economics with a master's degree in management. Ms.&nbsp;Chen also received a certificate of completion
	in financial analysis and investment management from the University of Toronto in May&nbsp;2005.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Feng Li
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	will serve as our Independent Director immediately upon the listing of our ADSs on NASDAQ. Mr.&nbsp;Li has approximately
	16&nbsp;years of experience in business management and financial education. At the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	130
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=134,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=382099,FOLIO='130',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]EG48101A.;150',USER='CLABIT',CD='21-APR-2016;23:45' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_EG48101_1_131">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	University of Michigan Stephen M. Ross School of Business, he was the Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young Assistant Professor from July 2004 to July 2011 and the Harry Jones Associate Professor with tenure from July
	2011 to June 2015. Since July 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Li has been a professor of accounting and director of the Finance MBA Program at Shanghai Advanced Institute of Finance of Shanghai Jiao Tong University.
	Since July&nbsp;17, 2014, Mr.&nbsp;Li has also been an independent director and the audit committee financial expert for Sungy Mobile Limited, a company listed on the NASDAQ (NASDAQ: GOMO).
	Mr.&nbsp;Li is a member of the American Accounting Association. Mr.&nbsp;Li graduated from Fudan University with a bachelor degree in economics in July 1996 and a master degree in economics in
	July 1998. He received his master degree in business administration from the University of Chicago in June 2004 and obtained a doctor of philosophy degree in accounting from the University of Chicago
	in June 2005.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ms.&nbsp;Jue Yao
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	will serve as our Independent Director immediately upon the listing of our ADSs on NASDAQ. Ms.&nbsp;Yao has extensive experience in
	accounting and corporate finance. Ms.&nbsp;Yao is the chief financial officer of Qihoo 360 Technology&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., or Qihoo 360, a company listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE:
	QIHU). From 1996 to 1999, Ms.&nbsp;Yao was a senior auditor at KPMG. From 1999 to 2006, Ms.&nbsp;Yao held various positions, including financial director, at Sohu.com&nbsp;Inc. Since 2006,
	Ms.&nbsp;Yao has held various positions at Qihoo 360, including as its financial director and vice president of finance from 2008 to 2012 and its co-chief financial officer of Qihoo 360 from 2012 to
	2014. Ms.&nbsp;Yao graduated from the University of International Business and Economics in China with a bachelor degree in international accounting in June 1996.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Lijun Lin
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	will serve as our Independent Director immediately upon the listing of our ADSs on NASDAQ. Mr.&nbsp;Lin is the founder and
	currently serves as CIO of Loyal Valley Innovation Capital, an investment company focusing on investing in entrepreneurship and innovation, founded in November 2015. Prior to that, Mr.&nbsp;Lin
	founded China Universal Asset Management&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., or CUAM, in 2005, a leading fund management company in China with USD70&nbsp;billion under management. He served as CUAM's chief
	executive officer and chairman of the investment committee from April 2004 to April 2015. Mr.&nbsp;Lin previously also served as a manager and an assistant director of the listing department of the
	Shanghai Stock Exchange and served at the CSRC as a regulator. Mr.&nbsp;Lin obtained a bachelor's and a master's degree in economics from Fudan University and a Master of Business Administration
	degree from Harvard Business School.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Gang Xu
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is our Vice President responsible for developing and maintaining our information technology infrastructure. Mr.&nbsp;Xu has over
	12&nbsp;years of experience in the field of information technology and Internet businesses. From March&nbsp;2003 to May&nbsp;2008, Mr.&nbsp;Xu worked as an engineer at two software companies.
	From July&nbsp;2008 to December&nbsp;2009, Mr.&nbsp;Xu served at two companies specializing in the development and sales of securities software. Mr.&nbsp;Xu co-founded a stock investor
	community website, 9666.cn (niuzaiwang) in January&nbsp;2010 and served as its general manager until April&nbsp;2011, before joining us. Mr.&nbsp;Xu graduated from University of Hunan in
	June&nbsp;2002 with a bachelor degree in computer science and technology. Mr.&nbsp;Xu graduated from Renmin University of China in June&nbsp;2009 with an MBA degree. Mr.&nbsp;Xu is currently
	pursuing a part-time EMBA degree at Shanghai Advanced Institute of Finance of Shanghai Jiao Tong University. Mr.&nbsp;Xu is the brother-in-law of Mr.&nbsp;Wenbin&nbsp;Chen.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Dikuo Bo
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is our Vice President responsible for our operations on the Guangdong Precious Metals Exchange. Mr.&nbsp;Bo was a manager at Tianli
	Jicang Cultural Communication&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., a company specializing in the sales and investment of collectible cultural products, from May&nbsp;2000 to July&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Bo
	co-founded Shanghai Tongguan Information Technology, a company providing financial information and services, in October&nbsp;2007 and served as its general manager until March&nbsp;2014, before
	joining us. Mr.&nbsp;Bo graduated from Dalian University of Technology in July&nbsp;1997 with a bachelor degree in chemical equipment and machinery. He studied in the postgraduate program in
	finance in Shanghai University of Finance and Economics from September 2003 to July&nbsp;2005. Mr.&nbsp;Bo is currently pursuing a part-time EMBA degree at Shanghai Advanced Institute of Finance
	of Shanghai Jiao Tong University.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	131
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=135,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=377972,FOLIO='131',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]EG48101A.;150',USER='CLABIT',CD='21-APR-2016;23:45' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_EG48101_1_132">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Jigeng Chen
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is our Vice President responsible for our operations on the Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange. He has over 11&nbsp;years of
	experience in the financial services industry. Mr.&nbsp;Chen was an investment consultant at Fujian Rulin Investment Management Development&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. from April&nbsp;2004 to
	December&nbsp;2007. He worked at a number of companies providing securities software and related services, from January&nbsp;2008 to May&nbsp;2011, before joining us. Mr.&nbsp;Chen graduated
	from Xiangling High School in July&nbsp;1999.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Qi Feng
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is our Vice President responsible for our operations on the Shanghai Gold Exchange. Mr.&nbsp;Feng has 12&nbsp;years of experience
	in the financial services industry. He worked at E-Money (Shanghai Yimeng Software Technology&nbsp;Ltd.), a provider of securities software listed on China's NEEQ (National Equities Exchange and
	Quotations), from June&nbsp;2002 to December&nbsp;2013, with his last position being general manager of the sales department. From April to November&nbsp;2014, he served as general manager at
	Tianjin Zhongyu Precious Metal Management&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., a member of the Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange. Mr.&nbsp;Feng graduated from Shanghai Sanmen Vocational School with a degree in
	real estate development and management in June&nbsp;1996.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Sheng Zhao
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is our Vice President and the general manager of our risk control trading center. Mr.&nbsp;Zhao worked as a designer at Beijing
	Qingyun Aerospace Instruments&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., from September&nbsp;1993 to July&nbsp;1994. He was a manager of major clients at Beijing Coca-Cola Beverage&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., a
	bottling facility, from January&nbsp;1996 to March&nbsp;2003. Mr.&nbsp;Zhao served as general manager at Beijing Zhongwang Lianhe Consultants&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., a company providing
	investment management services, from April&nbsp;2009 to April&nbsp;2010. He was the vice general manager at Tianjin Huanrong Precious Metals Management&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., a member of the
	Tianjin Precious Metals Exchange, from April&nbsp;2010 to June&nbsp;2011, before joining us. Mr.&nbsp;Zhao graduated with a bachelor degree in industrial design from Shenyang Institute of
	Aerospace and Industry in July&nbsp;1993. He graduated from the University of International Business and Economics in June&nbsp;2003 with a master's degree in&nbsp;finance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Jingbo Wang
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is our Chief Financial Officer. Mr.&nbsp;Wang has over five&nbsp;years of experience in corporate finance, equity and debt
	capital markets and mergers and acquisitions. He also has six&nbsp;years of research experience in management studies and computer science. Mr.&nbsp;Wang worked at Deutsche Bank from
	July&nbsp;2009 to October&nbsp;2014, with his last position being vice president in the Corporate Finance Division. Mr.&nbsp;Wang graduated from Tsinghua University with a bachelor degree of
	engineering in automation in July&nbsp;2003. He graduated from the University of Hong Kong with a master of philosophy degree in computer science in December&nbsp;2005 and was awarded a doctor of
	philosophy degree in management studies from Sa&iuml;d Business School, University of Oxford, in March&nbsp;2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Board of Directors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our board of directors will consist of six directors upon the SEC's declaration of effectiveness of our registration statement on Form&nbsp;F-1
	to&nbsp;which this prospectus forms&nbsp;a part. A director is not required to hold any shares in our company to qualify to serve as a director. A director who is in any way, whether directly or
	indirectly, interested in a contract or proposed contract with our company is required to declare the nature of his interest at a meeting of our directors. A general notice given to the directors by
	any director to the effect that he is a member, shareholder, director, partner, officer or employee of any specified company or firm and is to be regarded as interested in any contract or transaction
	with that company or firm shall be deemed a sufficient declaration of interest for the purposes of voting on a resolution in respect to a contract or transaction in which he has an interest, and after
	such general notice it shall not be necessary to give special notice relating to any particular transaction. A director may vote in respect of any contract or proposed contract or arrangement
	notwithstanding that he may be interested therein and if he does so his vote shall be counted and he may be counted in the quorum at any meeting of the directors at which any such contract or proposed
	contract or arrangement is considered. Our board of directors may exercise all of the powers of our company to borrow money, to mortgage or charge its undertaking, property and uncalled capital, or
	any part thereof, and to issue debentures, debenture stock or other securities whenever money is
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	132
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	borrowed
	or as security for any debt, liability or obligation of our company or of any thirdparty. None of our non-executive directors has a service contract with us that provides for benefits upon
	termination of&nbsp;service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Committees of the Board of Directors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Prior to the listing of our ADSs on NASDAQ, we will establish three committees under the board of directors: an audit committee, a compensation
	committee and a nominating and corporate governance committee. We expect that, upon the listing of our ADSs on NASDAQ, all members of our audit committee, and a majority of the members of our
	compensation committee and nominating and corporate governance committee will be independent within the meaning of Rule&nbsp;5605(a)(2) of the NASDAQ Listing Rules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Audit Committee
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Upon the listing of our ADSs on NASDAQ, our audit committee will consist of three directors, namely Mr.&nbsp;Feng Li, Mr.&nbsp;Lijun Lin and
	Ms.&nbsp;Jue Yao, and will be chaired by Mr.&nbsp;Feng Li. We expect that Mr.&nbsp;Feng Li, Mr.&nbsp;Lijun Lin and Ms.&nbsp;Jue Yao satisfy the "independence" requirements of
	Rule&nbsp;10A-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and Rule&nbsp;5605(a)(2) of the NASDAQ Listing Rules. In addition, we expect that Mr.&nbsp;Feng Li will qualifie as an
	audit committee financial expert within the meaning of the applicable rule of the SEC. The audit committee will oversee our accounting and financial reporting processes and the audits of the financial
	statements of our company. The audit committee will be responsible for, among other&nbsp;things:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	selecting the independent auditors and pre-approving all auditing and
	non-auditing services permitted to be performed by the independent auditors;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	setting clear hiring policies for employees or former employees of the
	independent auditors;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing with the independent auditors any audit problems or difficulties and
	management's response;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

	&sect;
</FONT>

	independent auditors;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>

<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	discussing with management and the independent auditors major issues regarding
	accounting principles and financial statement presentations;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing reports prepared by management or the independent auditors relating
	to significant financial reporting issues and&nbsp;judgments;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>

</FONT>

	transactions and off-balance sheet transactions and&nbsp;structures;

<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>

	and accounting initiatives;

<FONT SIZE=2>

	we received regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters and the confidential, anonymous submission by our employees of concerns regarding questionable accounting or auditing
	matters;

<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Compensation Committee
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Upon the listing of our ADSs on NASDAQ, our compensation committee will consist of three directors, namely Ms.&nbsp;Ningfeng Chen, Ms.&nbsp;Jue
	Yao and Mr.&nbsp;Feng Li, and will be chaired by Ms.&nbsp;Ningfeng Chen. We expect that Ms.&nbsp;Jue Yao and Mr.&nbsp;Feng Li will satisfy the "independence" requirements of Rule&nbsp;10A-3
	under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and Rule&nbsp;5605(a)(2) of the NASDAQ Listing Rules. Our compensation committee will assist the board in reviewing and approving the
	compensation structure of our executive officers, including all forms of compensation to be provided to our executive officers. The compensation committee will be responsible for, among
	other&nbsp;things:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing and approving the compensation for our senior executives;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing and evaluating our executive compensation and benefits policies
	generally;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reporting to our board of directors periodically;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	evaluating its own performance and reporting to our board of directors on such
	evaluation;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	periodically reviewing and assessing the adequacy of the compensation committee
	charter and recommending any proposed changes to our board of directors;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	such other matters that are specifically delegated to the compensation committee
	by our board of directors from time to&nbsp;time.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Upon the listing of our ADSs on NASDAQ, our nominating and corporate governance committee will consist of three directors, namely Mr.&nbsp;Wenbin
	Chen, Mr.&nbsp;Feng Li and Mr.&nbsp;Lijun Lin, and is chaired by Mr.&nbsp;Wenbin Chen. We expect that Mr.&nbsp;Feng Li and Mr.&nbsp;Lijun Lin will satisfy the "independence" requirements of
	Rule&nbsp;10A-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and Rule&nbsp;5605(a)(2) of the NASDAQ Listing Rules. The nominating and corporate governance committee will assist the board
	in identifying individuals qualified to become our directors and in determining the composition of the board and its committees. The nominating and corporate governance committee will be responsible
	for, among other&nbsp;things:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	identifying and recommending to the board of directors qualified individuals
	for membership on the board of directors and its&nbsp;committees;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing annually with our board of directors its current composition in light
	of the characteristics of independence, age, skills, experience and availability of service to&nbsp;us;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	overseeing compliance with our code of business conduct and ethics, including
	reviewing the adequacy and effectiveness of our procedures to ensure proper compliance;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	advising the board periodically with respect to significant developments in the
	law and practice of corporate governance as well as our compliance with applicable laws and regulations, and making recommendations to our board of directors on all matters of corporate governance and
	on any corrective action to be&nbsp;taken.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Duties of Directors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Under Cayman Islands law, our directors have a fiduciary duty to act honestly, in good faith and with a view to our best interests. Our directors also
	owe to our company a duty to act with skill and care. It was previously considered that a director need not exhibit in the performance of his duties a greater degree of skill than may reasonably be
	expected from a person of his knowledge and experience. However, English and Commonwealth courts have moved towards an objective standard with regard to the required skill and care and these
	authorities are likely to be followed in the Cayman Islands. In fulfilling their duty of care to us, our directors must ensure compliance with our memorandum and articles of association, as amended
	and re-stated from time to time. Our company has the right to seek damages if a duty owed by our directors is&nbsp;breached.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	134
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=138,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=693610,FOLIO='134',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]EG48101A.;150',USER='CLABIT',CD='21-APR-2016;23:45' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_EG48101_1_135">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	board of directors has all the powers necessary for managing, and for directing and supervising, our business affairs. The functions and powers of our board of directors include,
	among&nbsp;others:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>

	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	convening shareholders' annual general meetings and reporting its work to
	shareholders at such&nbsp;meetings;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>

<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	declaring dividends and distributions;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>

</FONT>
</DD>

</FONT>

</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>

</FONT>

</FONT>

	our company;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Terms of Directors and Officers
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our officers are elected by and serve at the discretion of our board of directors. Our directors are not subject to a term of office and hold office
	until such time as they are removed from office with
	or without cause by a board resolution passed by a majority of not less than one half of the directors or by an ordinary resolution of our shareholders. A director will be removed from office
	automatically if (i)&nbsp;becomes bankrupt or makes any arrangement or composition with his creditors; (ii)&nbsp;dies or is found by our company to be or becomes of unsound mind;
	(iii)&nbsp;resigns his office by notice in writing to the company; (iv)&nbsp;is removed from office by ordinary resolution or (v)&nbsp;is removed from office pursuant to any other provision of
	the articles of association.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Employment Agreements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We have entered into employment agreements with our executive officers. Under these agreements, each of our executive officers is employed for an
	initial term of two years, which term shall be renewed automatically for successive one-year terms unless a one-month notice of non-renewal is given by either party. We may terminate the employment
	for cause, at any time, without notice or remuneration, for certain acts of the executive officer. An executive officer may terminate his or her employment at any time with not less than one-month
	prior written&nbsp;notice.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Each
	executive officer has agreed to hold, both during and after the employment agreement expires or is earlier terminated, in strict confidence and not to use or disclose to any person, corporation
	or other entity without written consent, any confidential information. Each executive officer has also agreed to assign to our company any intellectual property rights that qualifies or is considered
	by the Company to qualify for patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret, or any other protection under the laws of PRC or Cayman Islands providing or creating intellectual property rights, during the
	period of the executive officer's employment with us and for a certain period following termination of the employment agreement that are related to the scope of the&nbsp;employment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	addition, all executive officers have agreed to be bound by non-competition and non-solicitation restrictions set forth in their employment agreements. Specifically, each executive officer has
	agreed to devote all his or her working time and attention to our business and use best efforts to develop our business and interests. Moreover, each executive officer has agreed not to, for a certain
	period following termination of his or her employment or expiration of the employment agreement: (i)&nbsp;directly or indirectly engage in (whether as an officer, principal, agent, director,
	employee, partner, affiliate, consultant or other participant), or hold an equity interest of 5% or more in, any business or activity that is in competition with the Company, its subsidiaries or
	affiliated entities; (ii)&nbsp;solicit, encourage or assist other employees of the Company to seek employment with any business or organization in competition with the Company, its subsidiaries or
	affiliated entities; or (iii)&nbsp;engage in other activities that may cause conflicts with the interests of the Company during the term of the employment agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	135
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_MANAGEMENT>
<EFX_DIRECTOR_COMPENSATION>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTOR_COMPENSATION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Compensation of Directors and Officers
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the aggregate cash compensation and benefits that we paid to our directors and executive officers
	was RMB3.9&nbsp;million (US$0.6&nbsp;million). No pension, retirement or similar benefits have been set aside or accrued for our executive officers or directors. We have no service contracts with
	any of our non-executive directors providing for benefits upon termination of employment. Our PRC subsidiaries are required by PRC laws and regulations to make contributions equal to certain
	percentages of each employee's salary for his or her retirement benefit, medical insurance benefits, housing funds, unemployment and other statutory benefit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Share Incentive Plans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Win Yin Financial granted stock options and restricted share units on its shares to our employees pursuant to its 2013 Share Option Scheme, 2014 Share
	Option Scheme and Pre-IPO RSU Scheme, or the Share Incentive Plans. Pursuant to the group reorganization completed on November&nbsp;18, 2015, our company became the holding company of the group and
	the majority of the operating PRC subsidiaries under Win Yin Financial became our wholly owned PRC subsidiaries. In connection with the reorganization, we assumed the Share Incentive Plans from Win
	Yin Financial and adopted the Amended and Restated 2013 Share Option Scheme, Amended and Restated 2014 Share Option Scheme and Amended and Restated Pre-IPO RSU Scheme. We have further amended and
	restated these share incentive plans to enlarge the authorized amount of options and RSUs by adopting the Second Amended and Restated 2013 Share Option Scheme, the Third Amended and Restated 2014
	Share Option Scheme and the Third Amended and Restated Pre-IPO RSU&nbsp;Scheme. We issued stock options and RSUs to our employees to replace the stock options and RSUs issued by Win Yin Financial.
	The terms and conditions of the stock options and RSUs with respect to vesting and exercisability remain the&nbsp;same.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We expect to grant options to purchase 50,000,000&nbsp;ordinary shares under the Third Amended and Restated 2014&nbsp;Share Option Scheme to our directors, officers and key employees on the
	effective date of the registration statement of which this prospectus is a part, at an exercise price per share equal to the initial public offering price of our ADSs adjusted to reflect the
	ADS-to-ordinary share ratio, which will vest in three equal installments upon the first, second and third anniversary of the listing of our ADSs on NASDAQ. Among them, options to purchase
	25,000,000&nbsp;ordinary shares are expected to be granted to our directors and officers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	purpose of the Share Incentive Plans is to enhance our ability to attract and retain highly qualified officers, directors, key employees and other persons, and to motivate such persons to serve us
	and our affiliates and to expend maximum effort to improve our business results and earnings, by providing such persons an opportunity to acquire or increase a direct interest in our operations and
	future&nbsp;success.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Second Amended and Restated 2013 Share Option Scheme
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The maximum aggregate number of ordinary shares that can be issued under the Second Amended and Restated 2013 Share Option Scheme, or the 2013 Share
	Option Scheme, is 41,000,000. As of the date of this prospectus, options to purchase an aggregate of 36,771,900&nbsp;ordinary shares have been granted by us and remain outstanding under the 2013
	Share Option&nbsp;Scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Eligible participants.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our employees, officers, directors, business associates or any other individual as determined by our board of directors, in its sole
	discretion, has contributed or will contribute to our company, are eligible to participate in the 2013 Share Option&nbsp;Scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Exercise price.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The exercise price in respect of options granted under the scheme before our initial public offering is US$0.163 per share, subject to any
	adjustment as a result of any alteration in the capital structure of our company by way of capitalization of profits or reserves, rights issue, sub-division or consolidation of shares or reduction of
	share capital of our company from time to&nbsp;time, but excluding, for
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	136
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_EG48101_1_137">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the
	avoidance of doubt, any alteration in the capital structure of our company as a result of an issue of shares or other securities as consideration in a transaction to which our company is
	a&nbsp;party.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Vesting schedule.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The administrator of the 2013 Share Option Scheme has the sole discretion in determining the individual vesting schedules and other restrictions
	applicable to shares awarded and opinions granted under such&nbsp;scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Administration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The plan is administered by our board of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Lapse of options.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An option issued under the scheme shall lapse automatically under certain circumstances, including, but not limited to, the expiration of option
	period, termination of employment for cause and the tenth anniversary of the adoption date of the&nbsp;scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Amendment.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any change to the authority of our board of directors in relation to any alteration to the terms of the scheme must be approved by the shareholders in
	general meeting. Subject to the above, our board of directors may amend any of the provisions of the scheme at any time provided that such amendment shall not affect adversely any rights which have
	accrued to any grantee at that&nbsp;date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Termination.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The scheme will terminate on the tenth anniversary of its date of adoption, unless terminated earlier. We may, by ordinary resolution in general
	meeting, or our board of directors may, at any time terminate the operation of the scheme and in such event no further options shall be granted. Options granted prior to such termination but not yet
	exercised at the time of termination shall continue to be valid and exercisable in accordance with the&nbsp;scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Transfer restrictions.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An option is personal to the grantee and shall not be assignable or transferable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Third Amended and Restated 2014 Share Option Scheme
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following is a summary of the principal terms of the Third Amended and Restated 2014 Share Option Scheme, or the 2014 Share Option Scheme. The
	maximum aggregate number of ordinary shares that can be issued under the Scheme is 200,000,000. As of the date of this prospectus, options to purchase an aggregate of 47,575,714&nbsp;ordinary shares
	have been granted by us and remain outstanding under the 2014 Share Option&nbsp;Scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Eligible participants.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our employees, officers, directors, business associates or any other individual as determined
	by our board of directors, in its sole discretion, has contributed or will contribute to our company, are eligible to participate in the 2014 Share Option&nbsp;Scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Exercise price.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The exercise price in respect of options granted under the scheme before our initial public offering is US$0.163 per share subject to any adjustment
	as a result of any alteration in the capital structure of our company by way of capitalization of profits or reserves, rights issue, sub-division or consolidation of shares or reduction of share
	capital of our company from time to&nbsp;time, but excluding, for the avoidance of doubt, any alteration in the capital structure of our company as a result of an issue of shares or other securities
	as consideration in a transaction to which our company is a&nbsp;party.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Vesting schedule.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The administrator of the 2014 Share Option Scheme has the sole discretion in determining the individual vesting schedules and other restrictions
	applicable to shares awarded and opinions granted under such&nbsp;scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Administration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The plan is administered by our board of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Lapse of options.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An option issued under the scheme shall lapse automatically under certain circumstances, including but not limited to, the expiration of option
	period, termination of employment for cause and the tenth anniversary of the adoption date of the&nbsp;scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Amendment.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any change to the authority of our board of directors in relation to any alteration to the terms of the scheme must be approved by the shareholders in
	general meeting. Subject to the above, our board
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	may
	amend any of the provisions of the scheme at any time provided that such amendment shall not affect adversely any rights which have accrued to any grantee at that&nbsp;date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Termination.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The scheme will terminate on the tenth anniversary of its date of adoption, unless terminated earlier. We may, by ordinary resolution in general
	meeting, or our board of directors may, at any time terminate the operation of the scheme and in such event no further options shall be granted. Options granted prior to such termination but not yet
	exercised at the time of termination shall continue to be valid and exercisable in accordance with the&nbsp;scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Transfer restrictions.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An option is personal to the grantee and shall not be assignable or transferable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Third Amended and Restated Pre-IPO RSU Scheme
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following is a summary of the principal terms of the Third Amended and Restated Pre-IPO RSU Scheme or Pre-IPO RSU Scheme. The shares in aggregate
	underlying all awards under the Pre-IPO RSU Scheme shall not exceed 100,000,000. As of the date of this prospectus, RSUs granted by us and remain outstanding underly an aggregate number of
	11,553,504&nbsp;ordinary shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Eligible participants.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our employees, officers, directors, business associates or any other individuals as determined by our board of directors, in its sole
	discretion, has contributed or will contribute to our company, is eligible to participate in the Pre-IPO RSU&nbsp;Scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Vesting schedule.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The administrator of the Pre-IPO RSU Scheme have sole discretion in determining the individual vesting schedules and other restrictions applicable
	to shares awarded under such&nbsp;scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Administration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The plan is administered by our board of directors. The board of directors may delegate the authority to administer the Scheme to one or
	more&nbsp;directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Lapse of options.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An unvested award issued under the scheme shall lapse automatically under certain circumstances, including but not limited to, termination of
	employment and the winding-up our company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Amendment.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The terms of the scheme may be altered, amended or waived in any respect by our board of directors provided that such alteration, amendment or waiver
	shall not affect any subsisting rights of any grantee. Any alteration, amendment or waiver to the scheme of a material nature shall be approved by the shareholders of our company. The board shall have
	the right to determine whether any proposed alteration, amendment or waiver is material and such determination shall be conclusive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Termination.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The scheme will terminate on the tenth anniversary of its date of adoption, unless terminated earlier. The scheme may be terminated or our board of
	directors may at any time terminate prior to the expiry of the scheme period provided that such termination shall not affect any subsisting rights of any grantee and in such event no further awards
	shall be granted. Awards granted prior to such termination but not yet exercised at the time of termination shall continue to be valid in accordance with the&nbsp;scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Transfer restrictions.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A RSU under the scheme is personal to the grantee and shall not be assignable or transferable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	138
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	following table summarizes, as of the date of this prospectus, options and RSUs that we granted to our executive officers and to other individuals as a group and remain outstanding under our 2013
	Share Option Scheme, 2014 Share Option Scheme and Pre-IPO RSU&nbsp;Scheme.

<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="140%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>

	date. The options granted under the 2014 Share Option Scheme vest based on the following schedule: (i)&nbsp;first series upon the expiration of six months from the date of listing of the this public
	offering or January&nbsp;1, 2017, whichever is later; (ii)&nbsp;second series on the first anniversary thereafter; (iii)&nbsp;third series on the second anniversary thereafter. The RSUs under
	the Pre-IPO RSU Scheme will expire on the tenth anniversary of the adoption date, January&nbsp;13, 2015.

	Table of Contents

</EFX_DIRECTOR_COMPENSATION>
<EFX_STOCKHOLDERS>
<A NAME="FIS_STOCKHOLDERS"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_EG48101_PRINCIPAL_SHAREHOLDERS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_EG48101_2">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	PRINCIPAL SHAREHOLDERS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following table sets forth information with respect to the beneficial ownership of our ordinary shares, as of the date of this
	prospectus,&nbsp;by:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	each of our directors and executive officers; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	each person known to us to own beneficially more than 5% of our ordinary shares.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	calculations in the shareholder table below assume that there are 1,000,000,000&nbsp;ordinary shares outstanding as of the date of this prospectus prior to the completion of this offering. The
	total number of ordinary shares outstanding after the completion of this offering and the Concurrent Private Placement will be 1,164,814,815 assuming the underwriters do not exercise their
	over-allotment option.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Beneficial
	ownership is determined in accordance with the rules and regulations of the SEC and includes voting or investment power with respect to the ordinary shares. Except as indicated below, and
	subject to applicable community property laws, the persons named in the table have sole voting and investment power with respect to
	all ordinary shares shown as beneficially owned by them. In computing the number of shares beneficially owned by a person and the percentage ownership of that person, we have included shares that the
	person has the right to acquire within 60&nbsp;days of the date of this prospectus, including through the exercise of any option, warrant or other right or the conversion of any other security.
	These shares, however, are not included in the computation of the percentage ownership of any other&nbsp;person.
</FONT>
</P>

<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">

</FONT>
</TD>

<EFX_CERTAIN_TRANSACTIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTAIN_TRANSACTIONS"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_EI48101_RELATED_PARTY_TRANSACTIONS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_EI48101_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CERTAIN_TRANSACTIONS>
<EFX_CERTAIN_TRANSACTIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTAIN_TRANSACTIONS_2"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Transactions with Certain Directors, Shareholders and Affiliates and Key Management Personnel
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Reorganization.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See "History and Corporate Structure."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Risk Sharing Agreements.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At the early stage of our operation, our customer base and customer trading volume grew quickly while we had a relatively small capital
	base. Out of concern that we could not withstand all the market risks associated with our principal positions, we entered into risk sharing agreements with companies controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Wenbin
	Chen, Mr.&nbsp;Ming Yan and Ms.&nbsp;Ningfeng Chen, respectively, to share any profit or loss generated from such positions. Pursuant to these agreements, certain percentages of our spread fees
	and trading gains or losses arising from exchange-traded spot commodity contracts with customers, regardless of being positive or negative, were shared among these companies and us. During the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, the percentage of such trading gains and losses shared with these companies ranged from 30% to 50%. The risk sharing agreements were terminated at the end of
	November&nbsp;2013 with no termination compensation incurred and the amount we shared under such risk sharing agreements in 2013 was RMB244.3&nbsp;million. As of December&nbsp;31, 2013, we had
	an amount of RMB6.9&nbsp;million payable and RMB3.0&nbsp;million receivable under such arrangement, which were all settled subsequently. We did not incur any risk sharing expenses with related
	parties in 2014 and do not expect to incur such expenses with related parties in the&nbsp;future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Research Service Arrangement.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to December&nbsp;2013, we outsourced research support services to Shanghai Han Yu Information
	Technology&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd., or Shanghai Han Yu, which was 100% controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Ming Yan. We entered into a service agreement with Shanghai Han Yu on normal commercial terms in
	November&nbsp;2011, pursuant to which Shanghai Han Yu provided research reports, VIP customer service, training of company personnel, seminars and other services to us. According to the service
	agreement, we are the owner of the related intellectual property rights of such research products and materials. In order to increase our control of research operation, we terminated such service
	agreement in late November&nbsp;2013. We did not incur any termination fee and total research service expense incurred was RMB106.1&nbsp;million for the year of 2013. As of December&nbsp;31,
	2013, we had a total of RMB0.8&nbsp;million payable to Shanghai Han Yu, which was fully paid in January 2014. We did not incur such research services expenses in 2014 and have no plan to outsource
	such services in the&nbsp;future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Related Party Loans.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2013, we borrowed unsecured and non-interest bearing loans with no fixed repayment terms of RMB50.7&nbsp;million from certain shareholders
	of our Company or entities controlled by those shareholders, which were fully repaid in 2014. On December&nbsp;14, 2015, we borrowed an interest-free shareholder loan of US$39.4&nbsp;million from
	our founders to increase the working capital of the Company, which was waived in full by our founders on the same day and the amount of such loans was recorded as additional paid-in capital of the
	Company. In December&nbsp;2015, we received an interest-free loan of RMB118.9&nbsp;million (US$18.4&nbsp;million) from a founding shareholder in connection with our reorganization, which was
	repaid in full in February&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	2013, we extended unsecured and non-interest bearing loans with no fixed repayment terms of RMB99.8&nbsp;million to certain shareholders of our Company or entities controlled by those
	shareholders, which were
	repaid in full in 2014. In 2014, an additional loan in the amount of RMB28.0&nbsp;million with the same terms of the loans issued in 2013 were extended to related parties, of which
	RMB21.5&nbsp;million were repaid in 2014 and the remaining amount repaid in May&nbsp;2015. In 2015, additional loans of RMB40.0&nbsp;million with the same terms of the loans issued in 2013 were
	extended to a related party, which were repaid in full during the same&nbsp;year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Other Related Party Transactions.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2014, Yin Tian Xia Technology sold application service totaling RMB1.8&nbsp;million to entities wholly and jointly owned by
	the three founders of the Company. During the year
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	142
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<FONT SIZE=2>

	December&nbsp;31, 2015, Yin Tian Xia Technology sold application services totaling RMB7.8&nbsp;million (US$1.2&nbsp;million) to entities wholly and jointly owned by the three founders of

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=147,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=106079,FOLIO='143',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]EI48101A.;88',USER='JATHANA',CD='21-APR-2016;14:15' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_EI48101_1_144">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>

</EFX_CERTAIN_TRANSACTIONS>
<EFX_SECURITIES_DESCRIPTION>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITIES_DESCRIPTION"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_EI48101_DESCRIPTION_OF_SHARE_CAPITAL">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_EI48101_2">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DESCRIPTION OF SHARE CAPITAL
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are a Cayman Islands company and our affairs are governed by our memorandum and articles of association and the Companies Law (as&nbsp;amended)
	of the Cayman Islands, or Companies&nbsp;Law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	of the date of this prospectus, the Company is authorized to issue a maximum of 3,000,000,000&nbsp;ordinary shares, with a par value of US$0.00001 each and of a single class. As of the date of
	this prospectus, there are 1,000,000,000&nbsp;ordinary shares issued and outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	amended and restated memorandum and articles of association will become effective upon completion of this offering. The following are summaries of material provisions of our proposed amended and
	restated memorandum and articles of association and the Companies Law as they relate to the material terms of our ordinary shares that we expect will become effective upon the closing of
	this&nbsp;offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	following discussion primarily concerns the ordinary shares and the rights of holders of the Shares. The holders of ADSs will not be treated as our shareholders and will be required to surrender
	their ADSs for cancellation and withdrawal from the depositary facility in which the shares are held in accordance with the provisions of the deposit agreement in order to exercise directly
	shareholders' rights in respect of the Shares. The depositary will agree, so far as it is practical, to vote or cause to be voted the amount of the Shares represented by ADSs in accordance with the
	non-discretionary written instructions of the holders of such ADSs. See "Description of American Depositary Shares&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Voting Rights".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Exempted Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are an exempted company incorporated with limited liability under the Companies Law. The Companies Law distinguishes between ordinary resident
	companies and exempted companies. Any company that is registered in the Cayman Islands but conducts business mainly outside of the Cayman Islands may apply to be registered as an exempted company. The
	requirements for an exempted company
	are essentially the same as for an ordinary resident company except for the exemptions and privileges listed&nbsp;below:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an exempted company does not have to file an annual return of its shareholders
	with the Registrar of&nbsp;Companies;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an exempted company is not required to open its register of members
	for&nbsp;inspection;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an exempted company does not have to hold an annual general meeting;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an exempted company may issue no par value, negotiable or bearer shares;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an exempted company may obtain an undertaking against the imposition of any
	future taxation (such undertakings are usually given for 20&nbsp;years in the first instance);
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an exempted company may register by way of continuation in another jurisdiction
	and be deregistered in the Cayman&nbsp;Islands;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an exempted company may register as an exempted limited duration company; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an exempted company may register as a segregated portfolio company.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Ordinary Shares
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	General
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	All of our outstanding ordinary shares are fully paid and non-assessable. Our shareholders who are non-residents of the Cayman Islands may freely hold
	and vote their ordinary shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Dividends
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The holders of our ordinary shares are entitled to receive such dividends as may be declared by our board of directors subject to our memorandum and
	articles of association and the Companies Law. In addition, our shareholders may by ordinary resolution declare a dividend, but no dividend may exceed the amount recommended by our directors. Under
	Cayman Islands law, dividends may be paid only out of profits and
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	144
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_EI48101_1_145">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	out
	of share premium. No dividend may be declared and paid unless our directors determine that, immediately after the payment, we will be able to satisfy our liabilities as they become due in the
	ordinary course of business and we have funds lawfully available for such&nbsp;purpose.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Register of Members
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Under Cayman Islands law, we must keep a register of members and there must be entered therein:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the names and addresses of the members, a statement of the shares held by each
	member, and of the amount paid or agreed to be considered as paid, on the shares of each&nbsp;member;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the date on which the name of any person was entered on the register as a
	member;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the date on which any person ceased to be a member.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Under
	Cayman Islands law, the register of members of our company is prima facie evidence of the matters set out therein (i.e.,&nbsp;the register of members will raise a presumption of fact on the
	matters referred to above unless rebutted). Upon the closing of this public offering, the register of members will be immediately updated to reflect the issue of shares by us as to the depositary.
	Once our register of members has been updated, the shareholders recorded in the register of members will be deemed to have legal title to the shares set against their&nbsp;names.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	If
	the name of any person is, without sufficient cause, entered in or omitted from the register of members, or if default is made or unnecessary delay takes place in entering on the register the fact
	of any person having ceased to be a member, the person or member aggrieved or any member or the company itself may apply to the Cayman Islands Grand Court for an order that the register be rectified,
	and the Court may either refuse such application or it may, if satisfied of the justice of the case, make an order for the rectification of the&nbsp;register.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Class of Ordinary Shares
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	There is only one class of ordinary shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Voting Rights
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Holders of our ordinary shares have the right to receive notice of, attend, speak and vote at general meetings of our company. Each ordinary share
	shall be entitled to one vote on all matters subject to the vote at general meetings of our company. At any general meeting a resolution put to the vote of the meeting shall be decided on a show of
	hands, unless a poll is (before or on the declaration of the result of the show of hands) demanded by the chairman. An ordinary resolution to be passed by the shareholders requires the affirmative
	vote of a simple majority of the votes attaching to the ordinary shares cast in a general meeting, which can be an annual general meeting or a special meeting of shareholders. A special resolution
	requires the affirmative vote of no less than two-thirds of the votes attaching to the ordinary shares cast in a general meeting. Both ordinary resolutions and special resolutions may also be passed
	by a unanimous written resolution signed by all the shareholders of our company, as permitted by the Companies Law and our post-IPO memorandum and articles of association. A special resolution will be
	required for important matters such as a change of name or making changes to our memorandum and articles of&nbsp;association.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	General Meetings and Shareholder Proposals
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As a Cayman Islands exempted company, we are not obliged by the Companies Law to call shareholders' annual general meetings. Our post-IPO memorandum
	and articles of association provide that we may (but&nbsp;are not obliged to) in each year hold a general meeting as our annual general meeting in which case we will specify the meeting as such in
	the notices calling it, and the annual general meeting will be held at such time and place as may be determined by our directors. We, however, will hold an annual shareholders' meeting during each
	fiscal year, as required by NASDAQ rules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cayman
	Islands law provides shareholders with only limited rights to requisition a general meeting, and does not provide shareholders with any right to put any proposal before a general meeting.
	However, these rights may be provided in a company's articles of association. Our post-IPO memorandum and articles of association allow our shareholders holding at least 20% of paid-in-capital to
	requisition a special meeting of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	145
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_EI48101_1_146">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_BG48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the
	shareholders, in which case the directors are obliged to call such meeting and to put the resolutions so requisitioned to a vote at such meeting; however, our post-IPO memorandum and articles of
	association do not provide our shareholders with any right to put any proposals before annual general meetings or extraordinary general meetings not called by such shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A
	quorum required for a meeting of shareholders consists of one or more shareholders holding not less than one-third of all paid up voting share capital of our company present in person or by proxy
	or, if a corporation or other non-natural person, by its duly authorized representative. Advance notice of at least seven business days is required for the convening of our annual general meeting and
	other shareholders meetings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Transfer of Ordinary Shares
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Subject to the restrictions in our amended and restated memorandum and articles of association as set out below, any of our shareholders may transfer
	all or any of his or her ordinary shares by an instrument of transfer in the usual or common form or any other form approved by our&nbsp;board.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	board of directors may, in its absolute discretion, decline to register any transfer of any ordinary share which is not fully paid-up or on which we have a lien. Our directors may also decline to
	register any transfer of any ordinary share&nbsp;unless:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the instrument of transfer is lodged with us, accompanied by the certificate for
	the ordinary shares to which it relates and such other evidence as our board of directors may reasonably require to show the right of the transferor to make the&nbsp;transfer;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the instrument of transfer is in respect of only one class of shares;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the instrument of transfer is properly stamped, if required;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in the case of a transfer to joint holders, the number of joint holders to whom
	the ordinary share is to&nbsp;be transferred does not exceed four;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the ordinary shares transferred are fully paid or free of any lien in favor of
	us; or
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" SIZE=2>
	&sect;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	such lesser sum as the directors may from time to time require, is paid to the
	company thereof.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	registration of transfers of shares or of any class of shares may, after compliance with any notice requirement of the designated stock exchange, be suspended at such times and for such periods
	(not&nbsp;exceeding in the whole thirty (30)&nbsp;days in any year) as the Board may determine.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Liquidation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On a return of capital on winding-up or otherwise (other than on conversion, redemption or purchase of ordinary shares), assets available for
	distribution among the holders of ordinary shares will be distributed among the holders of the ordinary shares on a pro&nbsp;rata basis. If our assets available for distribution are insufficient to
	repay all of the paid-up capital, the assets will be distributed so that the losses are borne by our shareholders proportionately. We are a "limited liability" company registered under the Companies
	Law, and under the Companies Law, the liability of our members is limited to the amount, if any, unpaid on the shares respectively held by them. Our memorandum of association contains a declaration
	that the liability of our members is so&nbsp;limited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Calls on Ordinary Shares and Forfeiture of Ordinary Shares
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our board of directors may from time to time make calls upon shareholders for any amounts unpaid on their ordinary shares in a notice served to such
	shareholders at least 14&nbsp;calendar days prior to the specified time and place of payment. The ordinary shares that have been called upon and remain unpaid on the specified time are subject
	to&nbsp;forfeiture.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Redemption, Repurchase and Surrender of Ordinary Shares
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We may issue shares on terms that such shares are subject to redemption, at our option or at the option of the holders thereof, on such terms and in
	such manner as may be determined, before the issue of such shares, by our board of directors or by a special resolution of our shareholders. Our company may also repurchase any of our shares provided
	that the manner and terms of such purchase have been approved by
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	146
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
