<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=208,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=615773,FOLIO='F-25',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]FQ48101A.;16',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_FQ48101_1_26">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_FA48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LIMITED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	16. ACCUMULATED OTHER COMPREHENSIVE INCOME (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	amounts reclassified out of accumulated other comprehensive income represent realized gains on the available-for-sale investments upon their sales, which were then recorded in "Trading gains /
	(losses), net" in the combined and consolidated statements of comprehensive income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	17. ACQUISITION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On November&nbsp;16, 2015, the Group acquired 100% of the shares of Sheng Ding from third parties. The results of Sheng Ding's operations have been included in the combined and consolidated
	financial statements since that date. Set up in October&nbsp;30, 2012, Sheng Ding is engaged in providing trading and investment services for online spot commodity trading through Guangdong
	Exchange. The notional amount of the long and short position of the exchange-traded spot commodity contracts at the acquisition date were RMB 45.6&nbsp;million and RMB&nbsp;7.0&nbsp;million,
	respectively. The goodwill of RMB 0.10&nbsp;million arising from the acquisition is recorded in other assets in the consolidated financial statements, and is not amortizable for tax&nbsp;purpose.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	following table summarizes the consideration paid for Sheng Ding and the amounts of estimated fair value of the assets acquired and liabilities assumed at the acquisition&nbsp;date.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=209,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=223395,FOLIO='F-26',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]FQ48101A.;16',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_FQ48101_1_27">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_FA48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LIMITED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	18. COMMISSIONS AND FEES (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Group earns trading commissions, spread fees and overnight fees from its operation on Tianjin and Guangdong Exchanges, which are settled on a daily basis. The Group earns trading commissions from
	its operation on Shanghai Exchange, which are settled on a monthly&nbsp;basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Spread
	fees are earned based on the quantity of the underlying commodities of the customer's trades. The amount of the spread fees for each type of spot commodity contract is fixed and set by the
	Tianjin and Guangdong Exchanges and varies by commodity types. Trading commissions are generated based on the notional trading transaction value of the customers at the opening and closing of a
	position. Overnight fees are generated from customers who hold a long or short position overnight to the next trading day. The spread fees, standard trading commission rate and overnight fees for each
	commodity are determined by the Exchanges where such spot commodity contract is&nbsp;traded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cash
	rebates are offered to customers on the trading commission and overnight fees. The cash rebates are determined by the Group on an individual customer basis and paid monthly. The rebates are
	deducted from the gross trading commission or overnight fees. Total customer rebates recognized during the years ended&nbsp;December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015 were RMB 81.21&nbsp;million, RMB
	192.26&nbsp;million and RMB&nbsp;166.89&nbsp;million, respectively. As at December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, outstanding customer rebates payable were RMB&nbsp;19.07&nbsp;million and RMB
	14.83&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	19. TRADING GAINS / (LOSSES)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Trading gains / (losses) consists of realized and unrealized gains and losses from exchange-traded spot commodity contracts with customers and special members, commodity future contracts, risk sharing
	contracts with related parties, and risk and return transfer agreements with third party fund, the realized gain from trading of physical commodities, and realized gains and losses from the sales of
	AFS investments, all represented on a net&nbsp;basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	disclosed in Note&nbsp;11, pursuant to&nbsp;the risk and return transfer agreements, the Group's gains / (losses) arising from exchange-traded spot commodity contracts with customers are
	transferred to, and absorbed by the third party fund during the contract periods. Fair value movements on the risk and reward transfer agreement are recognised as trading gains / (losses). Settlements
	are made on a monthly&nbsp;basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-27
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	20. OTHER REVENUES
</B>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Group recognized awards of RMB&nbsp;38&nbsp;million from the Exchanges based on customer trading volume of the Group. Awards from the Exchanges
	are recognized when there is reasonable assurance that they will be received and amounts can be reasonably estimated. The outstanding award receivable from the Exchanges is
	RMB&nbsp;6.94&nbsp;million as at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Government
	grants and others primarily consist of financial subsidies granted by provincial and local governments for operating a business in their jurisdiction. The government grants are
	non-recurring in nature and there is no assurance that the Group will continue to receive such government grants in the future. The outstanding government grant receivable is
	RMB&nbsp;12.42&nbsp;million as at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-28
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

</DIV>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	sales agent expenses are related to fees paid to external sales agent companies for their customer development services on the Tianjin Exchange. Such arrangements were terminated in
	June&nbsp;2014, and the Group established and used its own in-house sales team for customer development on the Tianjin Exchange since&nbsp;then.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	22. INCOME TAXES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Cayman Islands and BVI
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Under the current laws of the Cayman Islands and BVI, the Group is not subject to tax on income or capital gains. Additionally, upon payments of
	dividends by Yintech to its shareholders, neither Cayman Islands nor BVI withholding tax will be&nbsp;imposed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	Hong Kong
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Under the Hong Kong tax laws, subsidiaries in Hong Kong are exempted from income tax on their foreign-derived income and there are no withholding
	taxes in Hong Kong on remittance of&nbsp;dividends.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_85"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:9.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9.0PT;" -->
	PRC
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The subsidiaries incorporated in PRC file separate tax returns in the PRC. The PRC statutory income tax rate is 25% according to the Corporate Income
	Tax ("CIT") Law. Substantially all the pretax income of the Group is from the&nbsp;PRC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Income
	tax expense consists of the following for the years ended 31&nbsp;December:
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->

</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands)
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	22. INCOME TAXES (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	reconciliation between the reported income tax expense and income tax computed by applying the PRC statutory income tax rate of 25% to income before income taxes is as&nbsp;follows:

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The pretax losses from non-PRC entities consist primarily of administration expenses, including share-based
	compensation.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Yin
	Tian Xia Technology was granted the "qualified software enterprise" status in 2013 and is eligible for an income tax exemption for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013 (the&nbsp;year in which it starts making profit) and 2014, and is entitled to a 50&nbsp;percent reduction of income tax rate for the years ended
	31&nbsp;December&nbsp;2015 to 2017. Per share impact of such tax holiday is RMB&nbsp;0.03, RMB&nbsp;0.10 and RMB&nbsp;0.05&nbsp;for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In assessing the recoverability of its deferred tax assets, management considers whether some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized. The
	ultimate realization of deferred tax assets is dependent upon the generation of future taxable income during the periods in which those temporary differences become deductible. Management considers
	the cumulative earnings and projected future taxable income in making this assessment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Based
	upon the level of historical taxable income and projections for future taxable income over the periods in which the deferred tax assets are recoverable, management believes that it is more
	likely than not that the Group will realize the benefits of its deferred tax assets as at December&nbsp;31, 2014 and&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Deferred
	income tax assets represent the net tax effects of operating loss carryforwards and temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets for financial reporting purposes and the
	amounts used
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-30
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	at December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the Group has a net operating loss carry-forward for PRC income tax purpose of approximately RMB&nbsp;4&nbsp;million and RMB&nbsp;15&nbsp;million,
	respectively, which will expire between 2017 and 2019, and 2017 to 2020, respectively. The tax effect of the increase in net operating loss for which a benefit was recognized for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015 were RMB&nbsp;1.62&nbsp;million, RMB&nbsp;0.41&nbsp;million and RMB&nbsp;3.36&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At
	31&nbsp;December, 2014 and 2015, the Group had unrecognized tax benefit of RMB&nbsp;3.84&nbsp;million. The unrecognized tax benefits pertain to income recognition under PRC's tax laws and
	expense adjustments. The amount of unrecognized tax benefits which would have an impact on the Group's effective tax rate are RMB&nbsp;1.68&nbsp;million, RMB&nbsp;3.84&nbsp;million and
	RMB&nbsp;3.84&nbsp;million as at December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, respectively. A reconciliation of the beginning and ending amount of unrecognized tax benefits is as&nbsp;follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, interest related to unrecognized tax benefits was RMB&nbsp;0.6&nbsp;million, which was recorded as part of the income tax payable and income
	tax expense in the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Group's only major jurisdiction is China where tax returns generally remain open and subject to examination by tax authorities for tax years 2011&nbsp;onwards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-31
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_FA48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LIMITED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	22. INCOME TAXES (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Prior to the Reorganization, the combined financial statements include the combined financial position and results of the Transferred Entities. Upon the consummation of the Reorganization on
	November&nbsp;18, 2015, all of the retained earnings accumulated prior to the Reorganization was declared and paid or payable to a wholly-owned PRC subsidiary of Win Yin, for which no withholding
	tax was&nbsp;required.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Group has considered temporary differences on the book to tax differences pertaining to all investment in subsidiaries including the determination of the indefinite reinvestment assertion that
	would apply to each foreign subsidiary following the Reorganization. The Group evaluated each entity's historical, current business environment and plans to indefinitely reinvest all earnings
	accumulated after the Reorganization in its respective jurisdiction for purpose of future business expansion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the gross balance with respect to the undistributed earnings from the foreign subsidiaries is approximately RMB&nbsp;0.1&nbsp;billion. The Group has not provided
	deferred tax liability for such temporary differences that are indefinitely reinvested. The unrecognized deferred tax liability is approximately RMB&nbsp;10&nbsp;million. If future changes of
	business environment makes the Group to change its plan to allow some or all of the undistributed earnings to be remitted offshore, such temporary difference would become&nbsp;taxable.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_89"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	23. EARNINGS PER SHARE
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted earnings per share for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, for which the basic weighted average number of
	common shares are based on the 1,000,000,000&nbsp;common shares issued by Yintech upon the consummation of the Reorganization on November&nbsp;18, 2015, as if those shares were issued as of the
	earliest date&nbsp;presented.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	36,771,900&nbsp;potential
	ordinary shares issuable upon exercise of share options are excluded from the calculation of diluted earnings per share for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, because
	their effect is anti-dilutive.

<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_FU48101_1_33">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_FA48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LIMITED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	24. EQUITY SETTLED SHARE-BASED TRANSACTIONS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Win Yin granted stock options and restricted share units ("RSUs") on Win Yin's shares to certain directors, eligiable person and employees of the Transfered Entities. Compensation cost related to the
	grant of the share options and RSUs are recorded as expense with a corresponding credit to&nbsp;equity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Pursuant
	to the Reorganization completed on November&nbsp;18, 2015, Yintech became the holding company of the Transferred Entities. In connection with the Reorganization, Yintech issued stock
	options and RSUs on its shares to the Group's employees as replacement of the stock options and RSUs issued by Win Yin. The terms and conditions of the stock options, such as vesting and
	exercisability, remain the&nbsp;same.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock option
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Stock option activity during the periods indicated is as follows:
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=216,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=700365,FOLIO='F-33',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]FU48101A.;34',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_FU48101_1_34">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_FA48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LIMITED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	24. EQUITY SETTLED SHARE-BASED TRANSACTIONS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	weighted average grant date fair value of options granted during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 and 2014 was RMB 6.38&nbsp;million and RMB 51.90&nbsp;million, respectively. The
	Company didn't grant any stock options in 2015 due to the Reorganization, new grants were subsequently made in January&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, there was RMB 18.88&nbsp;million of total unrecognized compensation cost related to unvested stock options. That cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted
	average period of 1.58&nbsp;years. During the years 2013, 2014 and 2015, compensation cost recognized in earnings in relation to stock options are RMB 0.4&nbsp;million, RMB 6.95&nbsp;million and
	RMB 21.21&nbsp;million, respectively. No tax benefit was recognized on the share-based compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Fair value of share options and assumptions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The estimate of the fair value of the share options granted is measured based on a binomial lattice model. The contractual life of the share option is
	used as an input into this model. Expectations and staff turnover rate are incorporated into the binomial lattice&nbsp;model.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Because
	Yintech's shares did not have a trading history at the time the options were issued, the expected volatility was based on the historical volatilities of comparable publicly traded companies
	engaged in the similar industry. Expected dividends are based on historical dividends. Changes in the subjective input assumptions could materially affect the fair value&nbsp;estimate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Share
	options were granted under a service condition. This condition has not been taken into account in the grant date fair value measurement of the services received. There was no market conditions
	associated with the share option&nbsp;grants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Restricted share units
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On January&nbsp;15, 2015, Win Yin granted a total of 12,665,000&nbsp;RSUs to certain directors, eligible person and employees. The RSUs will be vested during the vesting
	period, subject to the fulfillment of certain operational and/or financial performance targets as set by the Board that are probable of being met. Upon vesting, each RSU shall be entitled to the
	transfer or issue of one ordinary share in the share capital of&nbsp;Yintech.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-34
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_92"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LIMITED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	24. EQUITY SETTLED SHARE-BASED TRANSACTIONS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</TD>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	fair value of RSUs at the Grant Date is RMB 23.40&nbsp;million. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there was RMB&nbsp;8.94&nbsp;million of total unrecognized compensation cost related to
	unvested RSUs. That cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 1.57&nbsp;years. In 2015, compensation cost recognized in earnings in relation to RSUs is RMB
	9.77&nbsp;million. No tax benefit was recognized on the share-based compensation.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In 2013, the Group extended non-interest bearing loans of RMB&nbsp;99.79&nbsp;million to certain Founding Shareholders or entities controlled by those Founding Shareholders.
	These lending with related parties, are unsecured, interest free and have no fixed repayment terms. During 2013, RMB&nbsp;189.42&nbsp;million of the loans to these related parties were repaid,
	which included the loans extended in 2012 of RMB&nbsp;90.16&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	2014, additional loans of RMB28&nbsp;million with terms same as the loans issued in 2013 were extended to related parties. During 2014, these related parties repaid loans of
	RMB&nbsp;21.53&nbsp;million. The remaining loan balances of RMB&nbsp;7.00&nbsp;million as at December&nbsp;31, 2014 were subsequently repaid in May&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	2015, additional loans of RMB 40&nbsp;million with terms same as the loans issued in 2013 and 2014 were extended to a related party controlled by the Founding Shareholders. All the loans were
	fully settled as at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	the years ended 2013, 2014 and 2015, an imputed interest income of RMB 0.40&nbsp;million, RMB&nbsp;0.09&nbsp;million and RMB 0.29&nbsp;million were recorded as a reduction to additional
	paid-in capital based on the tenor of the loans and the effective interest rate with reference to the basic lending rate published by the PBOC, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Borrowings
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In 2013, the Group received non-interest bearing loans of RMB&nbsp;50.71&nbsp;million from certain Founding Shareholders or entities controlled by those Founding
	Shareholders. These borrowings from related parties, are unsecured, interest free and have no fixed repayment terms. During 2013, RMB&nbsp;20.50&nbsp;million of the borrowings from these related
	parties were repaid. During 2014, all of the interest free borrowings from these related parties were fully&nbsp;repaid.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	December&nbsp;14, 2015, a shareholder loan of USD&nbsp;39.39&nbsp;million was extended to Yintech by Founding Shareholders to increase the working capital of Yintech. On the same date, the
	loan was waived in full by the Founding Shareholders and USD&nbsp;39.39&nbsp;million was recorded as additional paid-in capital of&nbsp;Yintech.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-36
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=219,EFW="2228372",CP="YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LTD",DN="1",CHK=943547,FOLIO='F-36',FILE='DISK130:[15ZCV1.15ZCV48101]FU48101A.;34',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='21-APR-2016;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_FU48101_1_37">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_FA48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LIMITED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	25. RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Also
	in December&nbsp;2015, the Group received additional loans of RMB 118.88&nbsp;million with terms same as the loans received in 2013 from a Founding Shareholder. The borrowings were
	subsequently repaid in February&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	the years ended 2013, 2014 and 2015, an imputed interest expense of RMB 0.40&nbsp;million, RMB&nbsp;0.28&nbsp;million and RMB 0.23&nbsp;million were recorded as an addition to
	additional paid-in capital based on the tenor of the borrowings and the effective interest rate with reference to the basic lending rate published by the PBOC, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales of application service
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In 2014 and 2015, Yin Tian Xia Technology sold application service totaling RMB 1.80&nbsp;million and RMB&nbsp;7.83&nbsp;million to entities wholly owned by the Founding
	Shareholders, respectively. The amounts were fully received in&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Risk sharing agreement
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In 2011, due to the small capital base of the Group's trading business and the market risks associated with the Group's open spot commodity contracts with customers, the Group
	entered into risk sharing agreements with entities controlled by the Founding Shareholders. Under the risk sharing agreements, certain percentages of the spread fees and trading gains or losses
	arising from exchange-traded spot commodity contracts with customers are shared with these companies. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, the percentage shared with these companies ranged
	from 30% to 50% and the amount of RMB 116&nbsp;million and RMB 128&nbsp;million shared was recorded against commissions and fees and trading gains / (losses), respectively. In
	November&nbsp;2013, the risk sharing agreement was terminated, with no termination compensation incurred. As of December&nbsp;31 2013, the Group had an amount of RMB 6.89&nbsp;million payable
	and RMB 2.98&nbsp;million receivable under the risk sharing agreements, which were all settled subsequently in&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Research service expense
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Prior to December&nbsp;2013, the Group outsourced its research support services to Shanghai Han Yu Information Technology&nbsp;Co.&nbsp;Ltd. ("Shanghai Han Yu"), which was
	100% controlled by Yan Ming. The Group entered into a service agreement with Shanghai Han Yu in November&nbsp;2011, pursuant to which Shanghai Han Yu provided research reports, VIP customer service,
	training to employees of the Group, seminars and other services to the Group. In late November&nbsp;2013, the service agreement was terminated, with no termination fee incurred. During the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, the total research service expense incurred was RMB&nbsp;106.05&nbsp;million. At December&nbsp;31, 2013, the Group had an amount of RMB&nbsp;0.79&nbsp;million
	payable to Shanghai Han Yu and the amount was fully paid in January&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	26. PRO FORMA INFORMATION (UNAUDITED)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Prior to the completion of Reorganization, the Board of Directors of Rong Jin Hui Yin, Jin Xiang Yin Rui and Yin Tian Xia Technology approved dividend distribution of RMB&nbsp;831.88&nbsp;million
	in 2015. As at December&nbsp;31, 2015, outstanding dividend payable was RMB&nbsp;126.88&nbsp;million, which was fully paid in February&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-37
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_FA48101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	YINTECH INVESTMENT HOLDINGS LIMITED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	26. PRO FORMA INFORMATION (UNAUDITED) (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Unaudited
	pro&nbsp;forma earnings per share has been computed to give effect to the number of shares whose proceeds would be deemed necessary to pay the excess distribution in the amount of RMB
	428.86&nbsp;million, representing the excess in distribution of dividends of RMB 831.88&nbsp;million over the earnings for the Group for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 of RMB
	403.02&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	supplemental pro&nbsp;forma information has been computed, assuming an initial public offering price of $0.675&nbsp;per share, the midpoint in the estimated price range set forth on the cover
	of the prospectus included in the Company's Form&nbsp;F-1 Registration Statement. The computations assume there will be no exercise by the underwriters of their option to purchase additional numbers
	of ordinary shares and as if these shares had been issued as of January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>

<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

</TH>
<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH COLSPAN=5 ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<B>
	Year ended December&nbsp;31,
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	27. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Management has considered subsequent events through February&nbsp;29, 2016, which was the date these combined and consolidated financial statements were&nbsp;issued.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	January&nbsp;13, 2016, Yintech granted a total of 13,741,271&nbsp;stock options and a total of 4,075,435&nbsp;RSUs under the existing schemes to certain directors, eligible person and
	employees. The stock options will be vested during the vesting period, subject to the fulfillment of certain operational and/or financial performance targets as set by the Board that are probable of
	being&nbsp;met.
</FONT>
</P>

	F-38

<A NAME="FIS_INDEMNIFICATION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_JA48101_ITEM_6_INDEMNIFICATION_OF_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_JA48101_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;INDEMNIFICATION OF DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cayman Islands law does not limit the extent to which a company's articles of association may provide for indemnification of officers
	and directors, except to the extent any such provision may be held by the Cayman Islands courts to be contrary to public policy, such as to provide indemnification against civil fraud or the
	consequences or committing a crime. Under our post-IPO memorandum and articles of association, which will become effective immediately prior to completion of this offering, to the fullest extent
	permissible under Cayman Islands law, every director and officer of our company shall be indemnified against all actions, proceedings, costs, charges, expenses, losses, damages or liabilities incurred
	or sustained by such director or officer, otherwise than by reason of such person's own dishonesty, willful default or fraud, in connection with the execution or discharge of his duties, powers,
	authorities or discretions as a director or officer of our company, including without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, any costs, expenses, losses or liabilities incurred by him in
	defending (whether successfully or otherwise) any civil proceedings concerning our company or its affairs in any court whether in the Cayman Islands or&nbsp;elsewhere.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
	to the indemnification agreement, the form of which is filed as Exhibit&nbsp;10.4 to&nbsp;this registration statement, we will agree to indemnify our directors and officers
	against certain liabilities and expenses incurred by such persons in connection with claims made by reason of their being such a director or&nbsp;officer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	underwriting agreement, the form of which is filed as Exhibit&nbsp;1.1 to&nbsp;this registration statement, will also provide for indemnification of us and our officers
	and&nbsp;directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Insofar
	as indemnification for liabilities arising under the Securities Act may be permitted to directors, officers or persons controlling us pursuant to the foregoing provisions, we
	have been informed that in the opinion of the Securities and Exchange Commission such indemnification is against public policy as expressed in the Securities Act and is therefore unenforceable.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_INDEMNIFICATION>
<EFX_SALE_OF_UNREGISTERED_SECURITIES>
<A NAME="FIS_SALE_OF_UNREGISTERED_SECURITIES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_JA48101_ITEM_7_RECENT_SALES_OF_UNREGISTERED_SECURITIES">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_JA48101_3">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;RECENT SALES OF UNREGISTERED SECURITIES
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the past three years, we have issued and sold the securities listed below without registering the securities under the
	Securities Act. We believe that each of the following issuances was exempt from registration under the Securities Act in reliance on Regulation&nbsp;S under the Securities Act regarding sales by an
	issuer in offshore transactions or under Regulation&nbsp;D under the Securities Act, Rule&nbsp;701 under the
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	II-1
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_EXHIBITS>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBITS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_JA48101_ITEM_8_EXHIBITS_AND_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT_SCHEDULES">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_JA48101_4">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EXHIBITS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT SCHEDULES
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Exhibits
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See
	Exhibit Index beginning on page&nbsp;II-6 of this registration statement.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Financial
	Statement Schedules
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Schedules
	have been omitted because the information required to be set forth therein is not applicable or is shown in our combined financial statements or the notes&nbsp;thereto.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_EXHIBITS>
<EFX_UNDERTAKINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_UNDERTAKINGS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_JA48101_ITEM_9_UNDERTAKINGS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228372ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_JA48101_5">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNDERTAKINGS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The undersigned registrant hereby undertakes to provide to the underwriter at the closing specified in the underwriting agreements,
	certificates in such denominations and registered in such names as required by the underwriter to permit prompt delivery to each&nbsp;purchaser.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Insofar
	as indemnification for liabilities arising under the Securities Act may be permitted to directors, officers and controlling persons of the registrant under the provisions
	described in Item&nbsp;6, or otherwise, the registrant has been advised that in the opinion of the SEC such indemnification is against public policy as expressed in the Securities Act and is
	therefore unenforceable. In the event that a claim for indemnification against such liabilities (other than the payment by the registrant of expenses incurred or paid by a director, officer or
	controlling person of the registrant in the successful defense of any action, suit or proceeding) is asserted by such director, officer or controlling person in connection with the securities being
	registered, the registrant will, unless in the opinion of its counsel the matter has been settled by controlling precedent, submit to a court of appropriate jurisdiction the question whether such
	indemnification by it is against public policy as expressed in the Securities Act and will be governed by the final adjudication of such&nbsp;issue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	undersigned registrant hereby undertakes that:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	purposes of determining any liability under the Securities Act, the information omitted from the form of prospectus filed as part of this registration
	statement in reliance upon Rule&nbsp;430A and&nbsp;contained in a form of prospectus filed by the registrant under Rule&nbsp;424(b)(1) or&nbsp;(4) or 497(h) under the Securities Act shall be
	deemed to be part of this registration statement as of the time it was declared effective.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the purpose of determining any liability under the Securities Act, each post-effective amendment that contains a form of prospectus shall be deemed to
	be a new registration statement relating to the securities offered therein, and the offering of such securities at that time shall be deemed to be the initial bona&nbsp;fide offering thereof.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	II-3
</FONT>
</P>
